commit_message:
Make keystone_data.sh handle existing and updated keystone client

Keystone client commands and options have been normalized and
keystone_data.sh needs to support both versions for a transition
period.

The merge prop for the updated keystone client is
https://review.openstack.org/4375

Necessary for bug 396422

Also fix an intermittent problem extacting IDs from command output.

Change-Id: Ib13445a0bd3029fb02b0b7a86e8e0b8278717b57

[{'created': '2012-02-23 06:15:49.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt vif-plugging fixes.  Fixes bug 939252 , bug 939254

- fix OVS vif-plugging on red hat / fedora by supporting recent libvirt
change that provides OVS + libvirt integration.
- Create unit tests that provide coverage for all libvirt vif drivers
- Correctly set vm-uuid flag in existing OVS vif-plugging mechanism.

Change-Id: I29eeeda92d44a1c026d1c17cf169a1bf2b5a0cc1
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt vif-plugging fixes.  Fixes bug 939252 , bug 939254

- fix OVS vif-plugging on red hat / fedora by supporting recent libvirt
change that provides OVS + libvirt integration.
- Create unit tests that provide coverage for all libvirt vif drivers
- Correctly set vm-uuid flag in existing OVS vif-plugging mechanism.

Change-Id: I29eeeda92d44a1c026d1c17cf169a1bf2b5a0cc1

subject: Fixes error if Melange returns no networks
messages:
[{'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-23 20:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

was this patch supposed to have more in it?  Seems like the code changes only address the latter issue mentioned in the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-02-23 20:55:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Agree with Dan; the commit message seems to be overreaching. Otherwise, the fix looks good, save for the fact that I'm currently trying to pull all instance_gets out of the network layer ;-)"}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2012-02-23 21:14:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Unfortunately, instance is not instantiated outside of the loop. If the loop is not called, when get_instance_nw_info is called in the return statement with instance['uuid'] we get a key error on instance not being instantiated."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-02-23 23:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Concerns address offline'}, {'account_id': 357, 'date': '2012-02-24 00:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Fixes error if Melange returns no networks

If melange returns no networks for the tenant the
loop that loads instance from the DB will not run,
causing an error. This loop also loads the same
instance every iteration, which is inefficient.
This small change fixes that.

Change-Id: I34d410fae3919e9e3f268d98efd01eecd2ed0a3f

commit_message:
Print error if nova-manage should be run as root.

Fix bug 939531.

This patch makes nova-manage print out a more friendly error message if
it needs to be run as root instead of failing with an exception
traceback.  It catches an EACCES error when opening the config file or
opening log files and exits cleanly.

Change-Id: I2bd2bf3750c2bd3d672a037edb56f2b0b9bf1379

commit_message:
Allow login post without region in POST data.

Handles an edge case where users trying to log in to the dashboard
programmatically may not wish to specify the region endpoint in the
POST data. Fixes bug 930363.

Change-Id: If4dc8ba8bc5b01eb5ecee77654a5d87b10677b87

subject: Restart openstack services after running stack.sh
messages:
[{'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2012-02-21 19:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Very cool!  This solves the "run stack.sh after host reboot" use case, from the looks of it.  Could you reference and assign this blueprint to yourself if you agree?  https://blueprints.launchpad.net/devstack/+spec/restart-services

A few comments - It would be great to add a usage comment at the top of start-stack.sh

Also, I personally would prefer ./rejoin-stack.sh, since if we call it "start-stack.sh"  users will think that is where they need to get started.  Also rejoin-stack.sh does not break tab completion for ./stack.sh'}, {'account_id': 2515, 'date': '2012-02-21 21:13:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2515, 'date': '2012-02-21 21:19:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure what the usage message would be, the command takes no arguments, or are you just looking for some comments at the top of the script. If you have a suggestion as to the usage message I'll add it!"}, {'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2012-02-21 23:23:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, I just mean to add a comment at the top somewhere, so that if some dev opens the file they know what it is for.  Like:

# This script rejoins an existing screen, or re-creates a screen session from a previously terminated run of stack.sh.

How's that sound?"}, {'account_id': 2515, 'date': '2012-02-22 13:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2515, 'date': '2012-02-22 13:37:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Awesome, done!'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-22 17:29:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

A couple of related notes inline.  Otherwise this is a great idea to restart a session.'}, {'account_id': 2515, 'date': '2012-02-23 18:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2515, 'date': '2012-02-23 18:11:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks for the comments Dean, I removed the return statement and included an additional screen window called 'stack' with a bash prompt"}, {'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2012-02-23 23:29:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This is super sweet, and will really come in handy.  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-24 00:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Life is good  ...  after remembering to remove the old stack-screenrc.

Thanks Derrick'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-24 00:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/1789/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-devstack-merge/169/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-24 00:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Restart openstack services after running stack.sh

* Added screen_rc function in stack.sh to save started services to stack-screenrc file
* Added rejoin-stack.sh to rejoin the current screen session or start a new session

Change-Id: I381a7832bc8a107bfbd51c5ecfbd2e9134cf0a0a
blueprint: restart-services

commit_message:
bigger-than-unit test for cleanup_running_deleted_instances

My team is going to lambaste me for this, but the
cleanup_running_deleted_instances was missing a
unit test. This lead to a bug in the refactor.
This patch fixes both issues; however
utils.temporary_mutation makes it hard to write a
proper unit test, this one hits the DB.

Change-Id: I93a595ffce4f17261f18a52d4c2a11434653a630

commit_message:
Remove cfg dict mixin

cfg now implements the collections.Mapping ABC

Use set_override() in tests rather than directly setting the attribute
since the cfg iterator doesn't iterate the attributes.

Change-Id: I9db09c778b0fed5e19e836ce4e6006f790e2fca0

subject: fix the style guide to match the code
messages:
[{'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-22 22:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-22 23:57:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Disagree. It's clearer to order by full module path (not by code) so you can easily locate an import. Why does it make sense to do this:

from a import z

import a.b


I want to look at the top of the list for 'a.b' knowing how the alphabet works. 'a.z' comes after 'a.b'."}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-23 23:19:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

this is a fix to make the style guide match the code, should we agree that it should be changed to what you'd like, the rule can be changed and all the code can be changed to match"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-23 23:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Mr. Waldon, approving this so as not to confuse future code reviews by referring them to something that does not match the style of the code around it.

If you want to change it back, be prepared to change the style of the rest of the imports to our agreed-upon new style.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-23 23:51:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Only add Quantum and Swift to Keystone catalog if enabled.

Incidentally removes some outdated (unused) settings from the
Horizon settings file.

Fixes bug 939820.

Change-Id: I61e97c194070e46d21a6c0eb66eef88bd14efeee

messages:
[{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2012-02-15 20:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

lgtm. tested against a devstack environment installed today.

Keypairs with duplicate names should not be created ... ok
Keypairs with name being an empty string should not be created ... ok
Keypairs with name longer than 255 chars should not be created ... ok
Keypair should be created, verified and deleted ... ok
Keypair should not be created with a non RSA public key ... ok
Keypair should be created with a given public key ... ok
Non-existant key deletion should throw a proper error ... ok
Keypairs created should be available in the response list ... ok

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 8 tests in 2.973s

OK'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2012-02-15 21:02:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

commit_message:
Fix for bug 931712. Make keypair test work.

Throw exception for 409.
Eliminate test for fetching key becuase there is no such API.
Eliminate negative test for empty public key because (spec?) the nova code doesn't care.
Change tests that were checking for 4xx responses to catch the thrown exceptions.

Change-Id: I3e880f888ec2534d87d035cea722fad4a5987444

Fix test_server_actions.

conf_from_devstack needs to set image_ref_alt
Add throw for all unlisted 4xx cases in rest_client

Change-Id: Ie511bfd28bda2e21e1ada7f3cbcd43304279ba67

commit_message:
Make user-update more robust

* User name and email are optional in an update
* Pull user-enable/disable into user-update as --enabled argument

Change-Id: I1de35069abfbbcb0d18fb69542db34ce46d66626

commit_message:
Add hypervisor_hostname to compute_nodes table and use it in XenServer.

This ensures the dom0 hostname is available to the API even when dom0 is "offline."

Change-Id: I1230c1871606fadc30f63ed97b56d54e51fd8833

nova-network can't deallocate ips from deleted  instances

Fix bug #939580

Signed-off-by: François Charlier <francois.charlier@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Fix inconsistient method names and add tests

Fixes bug 937104

https://review.openstack.org/3527 renamed methods in RoleManager:
get_user_role_refs() -> roles_for_user()
add_user_to_tenant() -> add_user_role()
remove_user_from_tenant() -> remove_user_role()

* Calls to old method names in Tenant and TenantManager are fixed.
* Add tests for all renamed and affected methods.

Change-Id: Idf569d7dd737c5ccc38b4ea8212d5336998ae0f1

subject: Fix quantum get_all_networks() signature (lp#936797)
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 209, 'name': 'Josh Kearney', 'email': 'josh@jk0.org', 'username': 'jk0'}, {'_account_id': 447, 'name': 'dan wendlandt', 'email': 'dan@nicira.com', 'username': 'danwent'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1935, 'name': 'Tomoe Sugihara', 'email': 'tomoe.sugihara@gmail.com', 'username': 'tomoe'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-20 09:20:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Looks good, but please include more info in the commit message e.g.

  Fix quantum get_all_networks() signature (lp#936797)

  The base NetworkManager get_all_networks() method requires
  a context argument.

You should be able to just do 'git commit --amend' and re-run git-review"}, {'account_id': 1935, 'date': '2012-02-20 12:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1935, 'date': '2012-02-20 13:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Mark, Thanks for the great suggestion. I updated the message.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-20 16:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-20 17:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Just a note: QuantumManager was not built with the intention of working with the os-networks extension, since Quantum itself is the API for managing networks.  

I suspect the fact that a get_all_networks() method already existed, albiet with a different signature, is probably just a naming collision (I think bhall added the method recently).  It looks like the two calls have the same semantics though, so I think this change is OK.  

From talking to Vish, I would not expect this same functionality to work in Folsom, as there is a good chance that Quantum-Nova integration will no longer be done using the network manager abstraction.'}, {'account_id': 1935, 'date': '2012-02-20 23:37:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Dan,

Thank you for the comment. If it looks OK, could you give me your approval?


>Just a note: QuantumManager was not built with the intention of working >with the os-networks extension, since Quantum itself is the API for >managing networks.

From looking at the code and web docs, that is not going to complete in Essex release, is that correct? IIUC, Quantum provides L2 management APIs, but for L3, we need nova's network features (nova-manage cmd, NetworkManager interface) which has os-networks REST API."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-20 23:42:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Yes, to the degree that the os-networks replicate the nova-manage commands in the Quantum Admin Guide, they are the best way to automate creation for Essex.  

I can give you a +1, but I am not a nova core, so it won't help you all that much :)"}, {'account_id': 1935, 'date': '2012-02-20 23:45:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Dan. I'm interested in what is going to happen in Folsom release:)"}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-02-23 18:04:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'm alright with this.

Dan: the issue is, right now we're actually looking to use the networks extension as a stop gap to get some of our functionality out there sooner. Exposing quantum as the front facing API has its own issues, and we believe this to be the quicker route, so this is a great fix to support the short term. In the long term, I completely agree with you."}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-02-23 19:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-23 19:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/1772/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/1555/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1182/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/2936/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-23 19:38:51.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

Fix quantum get_all_networks() signature (lp#936797)

a context argument.

Move cfg to keystone.openstack.common

Just code movement here, no changes.

This is so we can use openstack-common's update script to keep it in
sync. See:

  http://wiki.openstack.org/CommonLibrary#Incubation

Change-Id: Ieb8ce50071a85987152b995fa6773433b7671c48

commit_message:
Add attaching state for Volumes

bug 897726 Add "attaching" status for volumes and clear state on error
This closes a gap where multiple calls of attach for the same volume
can happen before the volume is actually attached.

Change-Id: I59d22ceda83729c1a455af9994c9ffec1912e23b

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-20 22:50:09.000000000', 'message': 'LDAP code  Authentication

bug 933852
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/933852

Merged over the code from the original keystone implementation and
streamlined the API somewhat

Unit tests run 100% and can be can be run against a live OpenLDAP server
Metadata functions implmented using the role API
Example config file set up for LDAP in etc/keystone.conf.ldap
Password hashing done via passlib.  Only does salted sha1, which is what simple_bind requires,  but is not secure.
added pip dependencies

Change-Id: I8d0eb30e8f5e9755228e1be33dffe2f5ac74fd19
'}]
commit_message:
LDAP code  Authentication

bug 933852
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/933852

Merged over the code from the original keystone implementation and
streamlined the API somewhat

Unit tests run 100% and can be can be run against a live OpenLDAP server
Metadata functions implmented using the role API
Example config file set up for LDAP in etc/keystone.conf.ldap
Password hashing done via passlib.  Only does salted sha1, which is what simple_bind requires,  but is not secure.
added pip dependencies

Change-Id: I8d0eb30e8f5e9755228e1be33dffe2f5ac74fd19

see inline'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-02-15 17:42:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

was there a reason for flags.FLAGS? Also, if it can be tested then why not add a test?

Recent changes have broken the passing of any nose flags so maybe we could do the entire fix here?"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-02-15 18:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Alex,

flags.FLAGS is used to check for the hide-elapsed flag.

I plan on working with Monty to "to get nova/testing/runner.py replaced by pure nosetests (with the openstack.nose_plugin installed so that we can get our pretty output)"

That just leaves the question should a short term hack (just detecting the 'hide-elapsed' flag, and passing the remaining sys.args to nosetests) be put in place or just wait for the new nosetests code to be ready?'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-02-15 18:49:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

ah gotcha. I'm all for getting rid of runner.py at some point.

This does break hide-elapsed though."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-02-15 19:36:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

RIght,  But if we only need to handle hide-elapsed, Its easy to check for that specific case while a better solution is developed.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-02-17 17:12:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

+1, lets just manually check for and remove hide-elapsed so we can get our nose options working again'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-02-17 20:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-02-17 20:44:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

commit_message:
Actual fix for bug 931608.

-x --stop is a nose flag
Provide short term solution to deal with '--hide-elapsed'

Can be tested by adding a assertTrue(False) in a test and running
./run_tests.sh -x

Chris,

More end-to-end testing unveiled a few more subtleties in host.py, which I believe I have now ironed out.

Thanks a lot for your review!'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-23 16:31:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-02-23 16:48:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

<rant>
My main objection in this patch is the virt layer getting more DB lookups, specifically around instances. As it stands already, we have entirely too much coupling between the different components. I know it's a necessary construct to make this work, but my personal preference for the virt layer long term is that it only operates on data that it already knows, or can get from the hypervisor. More succinctly, I feel like compute is the only thing that should be able to look up instances.

I think my objection above could be resolved by starting things like the maintenance mode at the compute level by aggregating all the data together than the host is going to want for the operation at hand.
</rant>

Otherwise, this is good functionality, so I won't hold it up over my personal objections."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-02-23 16:49:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: No score

Waiting for Behrens to come back around and confirm he's ok with the changes."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2012-02-23 17:03:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Matt,

fair point indeed; this coupling between the virt and the db layers is a bit everywhere, and some refactoring to stop it would be very beneficial for both maintenability and performance. 

As for the specific case, I aim to restructure this once the live migration branch for xenapi hits trunk, so that putting a 'host in maintenance' can be offloaded to scheduler/compute directly (as you and Chris obviously suggest).

Because of the E4 deadline and the minimal orchestration required with XenServer, I went for the quick and easy approach. Hope that's okay.

Thanks,
Armando"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-23 17:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-23 17:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified

Build Successful

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1177/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/2931/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-23 17:31:39.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
blueprint host-aggregates: host maintenance - xenapi implementation

this changeset introduces the following:

- refactoring around host-related operations for xenapi
- increased test coverage
- first cut at implementing host evacuation for a XS/XCP host

subject: Glance image cache and fast-cloning now opt-in.
messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-21 19:34:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I don't like switching the default behavior of this flag for libvirt.  If you really feel that this should be off by default for xen perhaps set the default to false for both of the flags in __init__ nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-21 19:34:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

This feels like you're treating the symptoms of a larger problem rather than tackling the root cause. Ideally you would make things easier to troubleshoot from a dev's point of view rather than affect actual deployments. Additionally, it doesn't really make sense to affect libvirt driver operation while trying to debug the xen driver (which changing the use_cow_images flag default would do)."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-21 20:10:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Vish:

I think the same reasoning applies to libvirt too: (most/all?) optimizations should be opt-in.

I don't like the idea of having a separate flag for xenapi just to enforce that though.

Brian:

Making things easier to troubleshoot is always a good plan; but in this case, I think having these optimizations turned-on by default makes little sense in either case.

I cited the issue w/ xenapi to give a concrete example of why this becomes an issue. Only after the fact, as you're analyzing the SR do you realize caching was causing the funny behavior. 

I feel like having this as opt-in behavior makes it clearer that you're trading some simplicity for more-difficult-to-troubleshoot (always!) but faster.


All that said, if we had to compromise here, would making glance caching default to false be on the table?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-21 23:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The issue is that caching and cow images has been on for libvirt for the entire diablo release, so it has the potential to break existing installs to change the default for libvirt.  In general it makes sense to default optimizations to false, but the defaults are also the things that get tested the most, so they should probably represent what we expect most deployments to use.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-21 23:57:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The issue is that caching and cow images has been on for libvirt for the entire diablo release, so it has the potential to break existing installs to change the default for libvirt

That's a valid point. Definitely don't want to break existing installs, especially this late in the game. That said, I still think it's the right answer, even if it's not the right-now answer.

In other words, I'd love to see us eventually move towards having this as default false in the future, but give people fair warning that this is changing.

> but the defaults are also the things that get tested the most, so they should probably represent what we expect most deployments to use.

I don't think Nova needs to make any guesses about which optimizations will be used in production. 

Presumably deployers will be testing with configurations similar to what they're deploying, so the most common deployment scenarios will be encoded explicitly in their nova.conf, not implicitly as Nova defaults."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-02-23 17:00:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Seems like the answer is to follow what Vish originally suggested, and duplicate the flags. I don't think we can expect to be able to change default behavior for other virts on the fly."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-23 17:06:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

Yeah dup flag is probably the way to go, though, since this was a bit more controversial than I thought it would be, and not really that big a pain point or anything, I'll go ahead and punt on this for now."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-23 17:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Met a less than stellar response.'}]

[{'created': '2012-02-22 15:24:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add Fedora to SAIO.

In the past we had a document at Wiki, called RHELInstructions,
but it was permanently out of date, and someone deleted it, in
order to stop the confusion.

Differences for Fedora as quite small and it makes sense to maintain
them inside the main document.

This patch also fixes a couple of obvious problems:
 - a missing period
 - unwanted leading space that breaks a paragraph

Still no idea how to remove color from [swift-hash].

commit_message:
Add Fedora to SAIO.

In the past we had a document at Wiki, called RHELInstructions,
but it was permanently out of date, and someone deleted it, in
order to stop the confusion.

Differences for Fedora as quite small and it makes sense to maintain
them inside the main document.

This patch also fixes a couple of obvious problems:
 - a missing period
 - unwanted leading space that breaks a paragraph

Still no idea how to remove color from [swift-hash].

Change-Id: I73cda027c9d9bf695cd640a6d55735d82fba0048

commit_message:
Implement get users for tenant

* Renames TenantController.get_tenant_users() to .get_users_for_tenant().
* Implelments get_users_for_tenant in kvs and sql backends

Fixes bug 932238

Change-Id: If90feac8f34e592b8ab8c01c391e5d7d94c01fbb

messages:

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-10 21:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

This causes issues with nova-manage db sync:

NoSuchTableError: fixed_ips'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-12 16:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-12 16:02:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Dan, should work this time.

If not, Let's dig into the problem together this Monday or Tuesday your time."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-13 14:58:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hu. Good work here. SmokeStack is happy!

I have concerns about 'test_walk_versions' however. 

Slowest 5 tests took 475.51 secs:
    456.38     test_walk_versions (nova.tests.test_migrations.TestMigrations)

That single tests adds almost 8 minutes to the time it takes for the unit tests to complete!

There is still value in running that test... but I'm not sure I want it to be on for every single unit test run. Should we make a new 'functional' test category for longer running types of unit tests."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-15 13:28:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-15 16:36:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I really want this fix to land but I agree that this is a pretty significant investment in time for one test.

+1 to new test section for really long tests."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-15 18:10:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd actually be fine if we disabled the unit test for this initial commit.

We can work on a separate category in another patchset.

Also Hu. You need a rebase: http://paste.openstack.org/show/4827/"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-15 18:22:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

agreed.  Maybe just add a Skip when you rebase and we can enable the test in a later patch'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-16 15:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-16 15:14:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-16 15:47:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Now it takes less than 6 seconds for snake walk.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-17 10:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-17 10:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Rebased and add support for postgresql'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-20 08:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Wow, what a massive amount of work. If we have downgrade code, we should be testing downgrades. No question.

Looking at the patch, my concern is that e.g. the patch may have changed the effective Diablo DB schema (046) and Diablo->Essex upgrades will no longer work. I don't think I could +2 this patch unless I could be very confident of that.

Some other thoughts:

 * Do we really need downgrade support? Is the main use case developers or for operators? If operators, is it for folks regularly deploying master, or folks deploying released versions?
 * Do we need to support upgrading between every version? Could we consolidate everything from 001 to 046 into a single "diablo" migration and only support migration from diablo to newer versions?
 * Where do the .sql files come from and do we need them?
 * The test code has a lot of driver specific code; can we not just use sqlalchemy to reset the DB?
 * Could this test live in tempest? Perhaps it would just test upgrade/downgrade between diablo and latest essex?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-20 09:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hu asked via email: "The schema shoudn't have been changed. Could you be more specific on this?"

Sure, I'm sorry. I should have elaborated.

Yes, I agree the schema should not have changed. However, it's very, very difficult to know that from looking at the patch or running the tests.

Perhaps you could generate the DB schema (e.g 'sqlite3 nova.sqlite .schema) from the stable/diablo branch and then do the same thing after syncing to 046 with your patch and comparing the output? If you just put the output into http://paste.openstack.org for reviewers, that would be helpful'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-20 09:09:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Thanks, I'll do that after dinner.

Maybe we can do it together."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-20 09:09:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: No score

Ok, I just did this myself

Compare http://paste.openstack.org/show/4898/ from stable/diablo and http://paste.openstack.org/show/4899/ with Hu's patch. They're identical. Great

My other more general questions still stand, though"}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-20 11:21:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Question: Do you really need downgrade support?
Answer: Quoted from bug #854905
	¨Gavin B (gavin-brebner-orange) wrote on 2011-10-21:
	 #2
	 Updating status and importance.
	 We need upgrade/rewind to work for production clusters.
	¨

Question: Do we need to suppord upgrading between every version?
Answer: If every single upgrade/downgrade works,
        complex upgrade can be composed from them.

Question: Where do the .sql files come from and do we need them?
Answer: Upgrade to specific version(based on original upgrade code),
        generated schema from ´sqlite3 nova.sqlite .schema´, then modify
        according the .py code.
        As mentioned in the commit message, they are supporsed to work
        around several bugs in sqlalchemy-migrate/sqlalchemy, for
        forward/backward compatibility.

Question: The test code has a lot of driver specific code; can we
          just use sqlalchemy to reset the DB?
Answer: The test code is based on glance test code, it has a comment
        about this:"
        # We can execute the MySQL client to destroy and re-create
        # the MYSQL database, which is easier and less error-prone
        # than using SQLAlchemy to do this via MetaData...trust me.
        "
        What I did is to choose to trust the original author.

Question: Could this test live in tempest? Perhaps it would just test
          upgrade/downgrade between diablo and latest essex?
Answer: If every single upgrade/downgrade works,
        complex upgrade can be composed from them.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-23 02:32:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Hu,

Thanks for speeding up the tests! I'm happy with this."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-23 02:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

lets do this!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-23 02:52:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/1760/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/1549/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1176/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/2930/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-23 02:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Make database downgrade works

Fixes bug #854905

Use sqlalchemy reflection whenever possible:
    http://sqlalchemy-migrate.readthedocs.org/en/latest/versioning.html

Work around sqlalchemy-migrate sqlite 'bool column not deletable' issue:
    http://code.google.com/p/sqlalchemy-migrate/issues/detail?id=143
    Add following sql scripts for sqlite:
        002_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        015_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        033_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        050_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        068_sqlite_downgrade.sql

Work around sqlalchemy-migrate sqlite 'table with foreign key column not
deletable' issue:
    http://code.google.com/p/sqlalchemy-migrate/issues/detail?id=94
    Add following sql scripts for sqlite:
        003_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        006_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        007_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        012_sqlite_upgrade.sql
        013_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        020_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        030_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        038_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        042_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        053_sqlite_downgrade.sql
        067_sqlite_downgrade.sql

Work around sqlalchemy-migrate 'migrate drops engine reference' issue:
    http://code.google.com/p/sqlalchemy-migrate/issues/detail?id=72

Add following sql scripts for long primary key to work with utf-8
mysql table:
    072_mysql_upgrade.sql

Add following sql scripts for postgresql:
    002_postgresql_downgrade.sql

Add snake walk test cases for database migration based on glance migration
test.

Change-Id: Ib454ecb4662bbf47736c1b12d9a4f969f180ceb6

subject: Implement get_tenant_by_name
messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-02-21 03:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-21 21:07:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

A couple of inline comments."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-21 21:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-21 22:49:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

Sorry to be picky"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-22 01:37:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(7 inline comments)

it looks like this is changing more things than the description would imply, and why is it needed to begin with? tenants/?name={name} seems to make little sense, i'd rather have a tenant_by_name url if anything :/

if this is a new feature that isn't even supported by the client i'd rather tell the spec to take a nap than make something nobody is using"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-22 02:53:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (5 inline comments)

My need for this came out of trying to write a script for adding users to keystone and not being able to get a tenant ID if the tenant exists.  Of course, the alternative is to always attempt tenant-create and have it return the ID if the tenant exists (maybe this should also be done anyway)  but I don't think you will always want to create a tenant every time you want to test for its existence or get its ID by name.

It also allows us to implement a follow-on in the client to use tenant names in place of tenant IDs without always having to pull the whole list from the server and searching it.  That is written and will be proposed once Jake's CLI cleanup is complete.  And the same for users and roles after that.  Of course this bit may be 'feature' and have to wait for folsom."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-22 14:55:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-23 00:39:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

which script is this that you are trying to write? at this point perhaps just grabbing the tenant list and finding this info beforehand would be better? I think the design of this api is pretty non-standard compared to the rest of the apis so i would prefer to not submit this at this point if it isn't critically blocking something"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-23 01:33:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I was generalizing keystone_data.sh for creating the users on essex-kvm.  The inability to get a tenant ID after the tenant-create was the real problem, this seemed like one way to side-step it and add something also useful for later.

It looks like tenant-list was fixed today, so I'll ash-can this branch and re-write the client side of this to implement the lookup from tenant-list."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-23 01:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

tenant-list has been fixed, this can be worked-around using that until a proper api fro name lookups can be designed.'}]

commit_message:
Implement get_tenant_by_name

Adds ?name={tenant_name} to GET /v2.0/tenants per API doc 3.2.3.2.
Also support GET /v2.0/tenants/{tenant-name}?type=name as an extention.

This creates two paths to get tenant by name, one that overloads a list
function with something that returns a single object and one that fits
the existing API better but is new and not used anywhere yet.

Both of these require client changes (https://review.openstack.org/4329)
to be useful but it is no longer required for testing.

Fixes bug 935770

Change-Id: If1f4734dac386f5d4fecb8efa868053ece6adda3

commit_message:
Move get_info to taking an instance.

This is a first step towards using uuids in this interface instead
of instance names (which are synonyms for instance ids).

Change-Id: I54b32a5020b0dbc21ba7156ed38ed188c483086b

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-17 03:10:13.000000000', 'message': 'Remove network_api fallback for info_cache from APIs

Fixes bug 932395

OS API and EC2 would query the network API when instance['info_cache']
had no network info.. or network info was an empty list.  The ideal was
to fall back to querying the network IP in case the cache was busted.

However, reality says this case is extremely common as it is the case
when instances are freshly built and haven't had network info assigned
yet.  The calls to network API are expensive and goes against the whole
idea of this "cache".

So, this patch removes the fallback to querying the network API.  In its
place, it adds a periodic task to the compute manager to periodically
sync the cache entry.

Since I had to fix a number of tests, I consolidated some things there
as well with regards to instance stubbing.

Change-Id: I493f811bcba4e99ac6a5756bcab473557d5c0104

commit_message:
Remove network_api fallback for info_cache from APIs

Fixes bug 932395

OS API and EC2 would query the network API when instance['info_cache']
had no network info.. or network info was an empty list.  The ideal was
to fall back to querying the network IP in case the cache was busted.

However, reality says this case is extremely common as it is the case
when instances are freshly built and haven't had network info assigned
yet.  The calls to network API are expensive and goes against the whole
idea of this "cache".

So, this patch removes the fallback to querying the network API.  In its
place, it adds a periodic task to the compute manager to periodically
sync the cache entry.

Since I had to fix a number of tests, I consolidated some things there
as well with regards to instance stubbing.

Change-Id: I493f811bcba4e99ac6a5756bcab473557d5c0104

commit_message:
Move --version to --identity_api_version

* Default to OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION before KEYSTONE_VERSION
* Copy in 'env' function from python-novaclient hat supports multiple env var names
* Fixes bug 936162

Change-Id: I3b4013408465ea45788517cb31afb7fc652e6e95

commit_message:
Re-adds admin_pass/user to auth_tok middleware.

Re-adds support for 'admin_user' and 'admin_password' options to
the auth_token middleware. This was removed in KSL.

Fixes LP bug #939015.
Change-Id: Ia6eb8ccf65777175964c1c1d2e58b8de54062d67

commit_message:
Update docs for Swift and S3 middlewares.

- Rename SwiftOperator variable to lowercase swiftoperator along the
  way.
- Remove reference to swift.cache as this is not working in our
  tokenauth version.

Change-Id: I5dfbc872f7d9d71417f45cdd0ac46c3efbe2f731

commit_message:
refactor a conditional for testing and understanding

_cleanup_running_deleted_instances was getting
difficult to understand, so I extracted a method
that contained the calculation about what is to be
deleted. Also, added tests for that method.

update: _shutdown_instance has an arity of three,
the existing code gives four arguments, one was
passed through to driver.destroy, which now has a
default argument that defaults to True, the passed
value.

update 2: Doh! pep8

Change-Id: I1a32512a4e0d80ba4dcc911b96790c29c1f36710

Disable usb tablet support for LXC.

libvirt does not support usb tablets. Disable it
if running libvirt-lxc. Fixes bug 935744

Change-Id: Ic648df4b3a5b66da089c7153971f0e8dd53bacdd

commit_message:
Improve unit test coverage per bug/934566.

bug/934566 identified an error which should have been caught by
more complete unit test coverage. This review extends unit test
coverage to include handle_base_image and is one of a series I
will be sending.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-21 18:32:27.000000000', 'message': "Don't store connection pool in RpcContext.

Fix bug 934575.

As Chris pointed out in the bug, there is a downside to this approach to
fixing the bug, in that a manager will no longer be able to use
context.reply(). However, it wasn't being used at all, and it's no loss
in functionality.  A remote method can still return multiple values (in
response to a multicall()) by using yield.

Change-Id: I0e5aff2e8a40ffd8390c0e19d89dd17e60a74130
"}]
commit_message:
Don't store connection pool in RpcContext.

Fix bug 934575.

As Chris pointed out in the bug, there is a downside to this approach to
fixing the bug, in that a manager will no longer be able to use
context.reply(). However, it wasn't being used at all, and it's no loss
in functionality.  A remote method can still return multiple values (in
response to a multicall()) by using yield.

Change-Id: I0e5aff2e8a40ffd8390c0e19d89dd17e60a74130

subject: Add exception SnapshotIsBusy to be handled as VolumeIsBusy.

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 706, 'name': 'Brian Lamar', 'email': 'brian.lamar@rackspace.com', 'username': 'blamar'}, {'_account_id': 708, 'name': 'Yuriy Taraday', 'email': 'yorik.sar@gmail.com', 'username': 'yorik-sar'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-11-09 03:28:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Is Bueno code wise. Would be nice if there was an associated test ;).'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2011-11-09 22:13:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Where is SnapshotIsBusy raised?  I only see code to handle the raised exception.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-11-09 23:46:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It can be risen in any volume driver. I don't know for sure if drivers included into Nova need this logic but in our case it's necessary.
Actually, it should be needed if someone, for example, tries to add snapshot functionality to SolarisISCSIDriver."}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-10 03:30:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

May I ask why the snapshot status is being set to "available" when this exception is caught? Also, test coverage would be preferable. Even if this isn't a 'bug' it's always good to have tests that prevent logic change in the future. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-11-17 14:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Status is set to "available" since snapshot (just like in case VolumeIsBusy) is not intended to be deleted, but kept in place.

As I can see, VolumeIsBusy handling is not covered by tests as well. Can you tell me, how I can test volume manager without driver?'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-01-24 06:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-01-24 06:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-13 19:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-13 19:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-13 19:24:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Where is SnapshotIsBusy being raised?"}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-13 19:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It is not raised anywhere now, but it will be used in coming-soon Nexenta driver.
As I wrote early, this is useful for drivers when target systems prevent deletion of snapshot if there is a volume created from this snapshot.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-13 19:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-13 19:34:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Just fixed the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-14 22:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This works for me. Thanks for clearing things up in IRC.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-15 17:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-15 18:20:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

looks good except for the inline comment."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-15 18:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-15 18:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-15 19:40:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Fixed'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-15 21:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-17 16:32:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

A minor cleanup, but I think it's a mistake to require an exception handler for correct behavior."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-17 20:04:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-18 13:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

Comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-21 10:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-21 15:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-21 16:33:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I still think requiring an exception handler for correct behavior is a mistake.

I can buy that the database update shouldn't be made at the driver layer, but it shouldn't be raising an exception then.

Just return a status to make it clear that the result should be checked and the caller may need to act on it."}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-02-21 22:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

There is 3 possible ways the driver call can end:
- deletion went fine;
- deletion failed cruelly;
- deletion failed gently, snapshot/volume is fine.

Currently delete_volume suggests that both fails are represented as exception while good non-exceptional return means success.

delete_snapshot handling mimics the same logic. I think, if this logic seems to be very bad, there should be a separate bug/change covering it. I my opinion, failure must cause some exception, it is a stone-solid logic.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-21 23:38:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Add exception SnapshotIsBusy to be handled as VolumeIsBusy.

This is helpful when driver can not delete snapshot if it has volumes
created from it.
Add tests for both VolumeIsBusy and SnapshotIsBusy cases.

Change-Id: I3fcc6b1ffdfbc7e22ed30ac832db500eb3260d04

I'm not sure I buy the approach of 'copy_from' being interpreted as an image attribute in our interfaces. This use case is similar to the 'purge props' function of the glance registry. We use 'x-glance-registry-purge-props' there, rather than 'x-image-meta-purge-props'. Really this is a feature of Glance, not the Image API, so it makes more sense to me to use 'x-glance-api-copy-from'. Brian,

Yep I see what you mean, copy-from isn't true metadata given that its not preserved in the registry and reported back subsequently on HEAD or /details requests.

Would a simple renaming of the header suffice?

Is the '-api' qualifier necessary, i.e. would:

  x-glance-copy-from

be cleaner?

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-21 22:08:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

A renaming of the header would address my design concern. I explicitly had '-api' in the header name since that was the subsystem that cares about (similar to x-glance-registry-purge-props indicating that the registry should pick up on it). [{'created': '2012-02-14 01:15:55.000000000', 'message': "Support new image copied from external storage.

Implements bp retrieve-image-from

Added support for a new header:

  X-Image-Meta-Copy-From: URI

where URI is a HTTP, S3, or Swift location that's accessible to the
glance API service. Where present, the image content is copied from
the external store to the backend store currently configured for
the glance API service.

Impedence between the representation returned by Store.get() and
the implicit requirements of Store.add() required careful iterator/
filelike wrapping.

Also rationalized the S3 and Swift functional test setup logic and
added a new decorator-based mechanism to allow a functional testcase
require multiple backend stores to be available and configured.

commit_message:
Support new image copied from external storage.

Implements bp retrieve-image-from

Added support for a new header:

  x-glance-api-copy-from: URI

where URI is a HTTP, S3, or Swift location that's accessible to the
glance API service. Where present, the image content is copied from
the external store to the backend store currently configured for
the glance API service.

Impedence between the representation returned by Store.get() and
the implicit requirements of Store.add() required careful iterator/
filelike wrapping.

Also rationalized the S3 and Swift functional test setup logic and
added a new decorator-based mechanism to allow a functional testcase
require multiple backend stores to be available and configured.

Change-Id: If783a09c273832b8926aabc60b7eba8b3ab956d6

commit_message:
cli now returns an exit status cmd is invalid.

Update keystone-manage so that it returns an exit status when
the specified command is invalid. Also prints out usuage on error.

Fixes LP Bug #938718.

Change-Id: I57f1e009e7485912ed7e03c7163ae9dda27def04

commit_message:
blueprint progressbar-upload-image

The goal of this blueprint is to make cli more informative.
Adds optional animated progressbar upload to the Glance CLI tool.
This animation is spawned by a separated thread and the following information will be shown:

1. running progressbar
2. percentage of data has been transferred
3. bandwidth
4. ETA for transfer completion
5. status such as uploading or stalled

The animation can be disabled by adding the flag --silent-upload to the command "glance add"

Change-Id: If954268c6d7b52c975f6c358134be4f587541aa8

commit_message:
Fix WeightedHost

WeightedHosts don't have zone attributes.

Let me know if I'm missing something and should be adding a hasattr
check instead of removing the zone reference.

Change-Id: If76f23fa46c965fc9004e35dd10da33e2bbb48dc

commit_message:
Implements admin logic for tenant_list call.

Incidentally this required refactoring the keystoneclient
tests to differentiate between calls that are explicitly
admin API calls vs. public API calls. Previously all tests
had been hitting the admin API endpoint.

Fixed bug 933786.

Change-Id: I50c2505aefb64636b7b64fbff045fd427715396b

commit_message:
Don't allow EC2 removal of security group in use.

Fix bug 817872.

This patch modifies the behavior of removing security groups via the EC2
API to better match the EC2 API spec. The EC2 documentation says that a
group that is still in use can not be removed.

A new function has been added to the db API to find out whether a
particular security group is still in use.  "In use" is defined as
applied to an active instance, or applied to another group that has not
been deleted.

Unit tests have been updated to ensure that an error is raised when
these conditions are hit.

Change-Id: I5b3fdf1da213b04084fe266c1a6ed92e01cf1e19

commit_message:
Wait for instance termination to complete.

This patch waits for instance termination to complete before trying to
delete the security group.  The last change to simply move the security
group deletion to after euca-terminate-instance was not sufficient, as
it has to wait until the termination is complete.

Change-Id: Icba579534f324afb4d44abd42d8c755834dd2a57

commit_message:
blueprint host-aggregates: improvements and clean-up

This changeset addresses a number of issues found during testing:

- avoid name conflicts during aggregate creation (see db/* changes)
- avoid masking of XenAPI.Failure if pool-join fails (see plugins/* changes)
- preserve VM placement decisions made during scheduling (see xenapi/vmops.py)
- ensure plugins are called on the right hosts in XS pools (see xenapi_con.py)
- stores master uuid in aggregate metadata for use in VM live migration and
  raise InvalidAction rather than Aggregate error if we attempt to remove
  a mster (see xenapi/pool.py and compute/manager.py)
- clean-up of unit tests

Change-Id: I881a94d87efe1e81bd4f86667e75f5cbee50ce91

commit_message:
Support fixed_ip range that is a subnet of the network block

This enables flat deployments where the instances live on the
'general' network.  For example, a typical home router uses
192.168.0.0/16 for the private network.  Cloud machines can be
assigned 192.168.100.0/24.  An example network create command:

nova-manage network create private 192.168.0.0/16 1 65536 \
   --fixed_cidr=192.168.100.0/24 --gateway=192.168.1.1

Change-Id: I17edd81e9bc21ca3320233b606c99e03e25201bc

commit_message:
Avoid TestClient error on missing '__mro__' attr

The TestClient unit test fails with:

   AttributeError: class Zeros has no attribute '__mro__'

on Python 2.6 running on Ubuntu Lucid.

Resolve by defining Zeros as a new-style class.

Change-Id: I97f8eaac31d34a68613e9b30a177191a9de281b0

These checksum files are required for the libvirt image cache manager to determine if cache files are corrupt. That's part of the nova image cache management blueprint I've been working on for a while.

Vish pulled the initial implementation out the other day because of issues, and I promised to rework it and resubmit. This is that reworking.

Sorry I didn't provide this detail in the commit message originally. I'll do some timings and get back to you about that."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-02-20 08:00:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

commit_message:
Rework base file checksums.

The libvirt image cache manager wants to verify that the images it
is managing have not become corrupt. We therefore write checksums
for these images to disk and verify them as part of the cache
management periodic task. This checksumming was originally done as
part of the setup for a new virtual machine. This has been
refactored so that generating a checksum on a large file will not
delay the startup of a VM.

Note that these checksums are intended for detecting corruption,
not malicious system admins.

Change-Id: I781877b342207cb2cf03eb48bd89456846cbf487

commit_message:
Promote more complete support for ISO 8601 time.

Support for ISO 861 time representation is now duplicated in nova:

  https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/c30193fbf

and in glance:

  https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/f8f9f171

Note this patch introduces a new dependency on python-iso8601, which
has already been packaged for Fedora, EPEL and Ubuntu/Debian.

Change-Id: I87c32effa97d3b7a8d869522b62c0c6fb31bcef8

commit_message:
blueprint host-aggregates: host maintenance

First cut at implementing host maintenance (aka host evacuation). This allows
zero-downtime upgrades of the hosts by moving VMs off of to another host to
carry out hypervisor upgrades.

A number of issues have been addressed in this changeset:

- improved the semantic of update operation on hosts (as per dabo comment)
- refactored host-related operations into a separate class in to improve
  readability/maintainability
- refactored test_hosts to reduce duplicated code
- added first stub of host-maintenance operation

Change-Id: I933f7cb8736e56c9ecea5255936d8826ef6decec

You mentioned possible refactoring against RabbitNotifier ... I'm curious, what refactoring would you do?  The new notifier appears to be pretty much an exact copy."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2012-02-15 15:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It is a blatant copy. Unfortunately function/module based code makes it a little trickier to refactor. But, I would pull the code out of the common notify() functions and introduce a new notifier/common.py file. Each call would delegate to there. 

Really the only difference is the flag that determines the exchange they publish to.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2012-02-15 15:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-02-15 15:47:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Couldn't you just configure the existing one to use the exchange you want instead of adding a new notifier?

Maybe making the existing notifier support sending a notification to more than one exchange would be useful."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2012-02-15 16:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Scheduler notifications added.

Re-added lost fake virt hypervisor info (required for local dev).
Added multiple exchange topic support to RabbitNotifier.

Change-Id: I33cc9076ee35061c21852cabba3275006fc87b86

commit_message:
blueprint host-aggregates: xenapi implementation

This commit introduces some clean-up/improvements on the current model
and api for host aggregates. It also introduces a first version of the
xenapi implementation. More precisely:

- it lays out the structure of the virt driver,
- it introduces compute and xenapi unit tests coverage,
- it deals with join/eject of pool master and slaves,
- it fixes xenapi_conn, when used in resource pool configurations

More commits to follow (to ensure that VM placement, networking setup,
performance metrics work just as well in cases where resource pools
are present). However, these may be outside the scope of this blueprint
and considered as ad-hoc bug fixes.

Change-Id: Ib3cff71160264c5547e1c060d3fd566ad87337cb

[{'created': '2012-02-21 22:00:10.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid copying file if dst is a directory.

Fixes bug 938153

`shutil.move` in Python 2.4 will fallback to copying the file if dst is
a directory. See http://bugs.python.org/issue1577.

Change-Id: I2390337d82db5a72fef0e63877401134b1dcca55
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid copying file if dst is a directory.

Fixes bug 938153

`shutil.move` in Python 2.4 will fallback to copying the file if dst is
a directory. See http://bugs.python.org/issue1577.

Change-Id: I2390337d82db5a72fef0e63877401134b1dcca55

[{'created': '2012-02-21 23:39:32.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup of quantum dependencies and imports.

Note: python-gflags is still a dependency for the quantum client,
but the client's setup.py properly lists it as a dependency so
we don't need it in our pip-requires.

Given that we now detect quantum fully from the keystone service catalog,
there are no settings/configuration for it in horizon anymore, and there
are no special dependencies for it beyond the client, I'm
saying that this fixes bug 893466.

Change-Id: I2f31215974082fd354ab7fd274a6643010640fa8
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup of quantum dependencies and imports.

Note: python-gflags is still a dependency for the quantum client,
but the client's setup.py properly lists it as a dependency so
we don't need it in our pip-requires.

Given that we now detect quantum fully from the keystone service catalog,
there are no settings/configuration for it in horizon anymore, and there
are no special dependencies for it beyond the client, I'm
saying that this fixes bug 893466.

Change-Id: I2f31215974082fd354ab7fd274a6643010640fa8

had long discussion with Bob about this.  We agree to put patch in, as it is just wrapper scripts in the bin directory and thus, moving it does not actually pollute the python namespace.  We will revisit this when we discuss whether plugins should be in the main repo at all for Folsom.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-02-22 00:51:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Really glad you were able to take on this work Bob.

Only comment is that it seems a bit odd to plugin-specific executable in the main 'bin' directory.  To date, we've tried to keep plugin-specific code in the respective quantum.plugins.plugin-name directory.  Over time, the number of such executables will likely grow (we're adding a two more plugins in E-4).  The email thread discussing this change-set was long, so I may have missed the discussion on this one though, and I don't see this as a major issue (whereas the other items fixed by this patch are important).

Will hold at +1 so we can wrap discuss this point."}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-02-22 00:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks Robert, very nice work.

We had several discussions over emails and the changes seem to be in alignment with those discussions.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-02-22 00:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

In response to Dan's comment, I wouldn't characterize the executables in quantum/bin as plugin code - they are simply convenience wrappers that allow the agents (and other executables) to be easily run from the source tree by putting quantum/bin on PATH. Also note that these wrappers are not installed by "python setup.py install" - wrappers are generated in <installroot>/usr/bin instead.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-02-22 00:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-22 00:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Cleanup the source distribution.

Missing text files such as LICENSE and various READMEs are now
included in the tarball source distribution. The Makefile and shell
script for installing the openvswitch agent on xen are also now
included. The openvswitch and linuxbridge agents are included, and
executable wrapper scripts for the agents are provided. The cisco and
linuxbridge nova drivers are now setup to be run from the quantum
namespace rather than copied to nova. Finally, the setup_*.py scripts
have been removed from the project. Fixes bug 925074.

Test by running "python setup.py sdist" and examining the generated
tarball.

Change-Id: I33d336a5eb13678e6d527b575958393b337b6f3d
Signed-off-by: Bob Kukura <rkukura@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-21 22:47:50.000000000', 'message': 'Delete security group after terminating instance.

This patch slightly modifies the order of operations in the euca exercise
script.  It moves the deletion of the security group to the end, after
the instance has been terminated.  The reason this change must be made
is because of this change proposed to nova:

    https://review.openstack.org/#change,4154

Without this change, when exercise.sh is run against this patch, the euca
exercises will fail when the security group is deleted.  Moving it to the
end should make it pass, as the security group will no longer be in use.

Change-Id: I9095a02c42173ed1837ec20b38d5ef00fe4474ec
'}]
commit_message:
Delete security group after terminating instance.

This patch slightly modifies the order of operations in the euca exercise
script.  It moves the deletion of the security group to the end, after
the instance has been terminated.  The reason this change must be made
is because of this change proposed to nova:

    https://review.openstack.org/#change,4154

Without this change, when exercise.sh is run against this patch, the euca
exercises will fail when the security group is deleted.  Moving it to the
end should make it pass, as the security group will no longer be in use.

Change-Id: I9095a02c42173ed1837ec20b38d5ef00fe4474ec

commit_message:
Set include_package_data=True in setup.py.

Fixes issue where migrate.cfg was not getting installed.

Also, remove the previous 'data_files' fix from setup.py as it causes files
to get copied to the wrong location on install.

Fixes LP Bug #937265

Change-Id: I94e89271660baca4408df470a122e127540a4131

Updates.

Change-Id: I5c4744a14719393e4dc35c5ef6a292c57a81527c

commit_message:
Remove data_files section from setup.py.

'data_files' is probably not the best way to get migrate.cfg into
the tarball. Updating MANIFEST.in seems to work just fine.

Fixes LP Bug #937265

Change-Id: I94e89271660baca4408df470a122e127540a4131

[{'created': '2012-02-21 14:56:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove duplicated glance paste config.

When glance paste config was split out from the core config,
devstack duplicated the former in both files in order to work
around the chicken-and-egg problem with the glance change being
gated on devstack passing.

This transitionary arrangement is no longer required so may now
be removed.

Change-Id: I42ff9cd8ea9cae62a2a0cb72490f1c8a6c17056c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove duplicated glance paste config.

When glance paste config was split out from the core config,
devstack duplicated the former in both files in order to work
around the chicken-and-egg problem with the glance change being
gated on devstack passing.

This transitionary arrangement is no longer required so may now
be removed.

Change-Id: I42ff9cd8ea9cae62a2a0cb72490f1c8a6c17056c

commit_message:
Update api-paste.ini with new auth_token settings.

Update api-paste.ini with new 'admin_user' and 'admin_password' settings
for the keystone auth_token middleware. By default username and password
are options commented out.

Fixes LP bug #930310.

Change-Id: I04f91df5641d377d52c9578cade131bce5bfd4a4

commit_message:
allow '=' inside value of --meta=key=value

Previously, you could not specify '--meta=mykey=value=1', as the
second '=' would cause an exception when creating a dictionary.

The key name cannot contain a '=', but the value can, so we split only
once on '='.

Fixes bug 934515.

Change-Id: Ia416c3df59283fa963eb80370457e6c481336915

subject: Moving WADLs, XSDs, and samples from openstack/keystone
messages:
[{'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-02-16 22:01:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This probably deserves some extra review love, but I removed as many absolute links (e.g. to github.com/openstack/keystone) as I could (but there are still some I'm not sure how to fix, like absolute references to /home/yogi/...), replaced tabs with spaces, trailing whitespace, and relative links to samples, XSD's, and common.ent."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-16 22:58:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hi Dolph - I took a quick look, and I think you're going to need to keep the same directory structure as in keystone/content/: 

admin dir
common dir
service dir

WADLs live in the admin and service directories, samples and the .ent live in the common directory.

Not sure if I patch this what we'd end up with but let me know if you want me to try a patch."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-02-16 23:50:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In that case, there will be two samples folders, or should they be merged into common/samples?

Should the existing identity-api xml files move into admin/ and/or service/ as appropriate?

And I assume the common/style and common/js folders should stay behind?'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-17 16:25:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Q:In that case, there will be two samples folders, or should they be merged into common/samples?
A:Merge them into common/samples.

Q:Should the existing identity-api xml files move into admin/ and/or service/ as appropriate?
A: I think this is a straight replace.

Q: And I assume the common/style and common/js folders should stay behind?
A: Bring those over too.

I believe that you'll know if you succeeded when you can run

mvn clean generate-sources

in the location of the pom.xml file and get a BUILD SUCCESS. That's what Jenkins does."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-02-21 16:21:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2012-02-14 15:18:31.000000000', 'message': "Fixes bug 928251,remove tenantid in admin commands

This bug was caused by mixing admin commands with tenanted commands.
Now all admin specific commands won't pass the tenant_id when
constructing the url. The non-admin counterparts of these commands are
extracted into separate commands.

Change-Id: I82d75254468ec978da99aa2a612a67e9e39c3f51
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes bug 928251,remove tenantid in admin commands

This bug was caused by mixing admin commands with tenanted commands.
Now all admin specific commands won't pass the tenant_id when
constructing the url. The non-admin counterparts of these commands are
extracted into separate commands.

Change-Id: I82d75254468ec978da99aa2a612a67e9e39c3f51

avoid redundant checksumming in libvirt cache manager

Don't waste resources periodically checksumming
the cached images, unless that feature is enabled.

commit_message:
Update swift.common.client with bin/swift changes.

- Add auth version 2 to swift.common.client.
- Remove ununsed imports.
- Fix bug where auth_version should be a string.
- Add test for auth version 2.
- Allow to override the returns of http_connection for tests.
- TODO: properly test auth_v1.
- Fixes bug 885011
- Address: Maru newby review.

Change-Id: I807c02a308b8384b1aece93bb0815428eac7d98e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-20 22:10:51.000000000', 'message': 'disk/container_format required on image activate

Fixes lp 937216

The initial change[1] to require the container and disk formats be
explicitly set was enforced on the initial image POST, regardless
of whether the image content accompanied that request (either in
as the entiy-body, or externally specified via x-image-meta-location).

This turned out to be overly restrictive, as these formats may not
be known to the caller until the image content is supplied via a
subsequent PUT on the new image.

Now we only enforce the strict requirement for these formats to be
non-empty when the image is activated (as opposed to the initial
enqueue).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/62c913c3

Change-Id: I89e068f35fd7da427b547b18cdea4ae84ab3ec87
'}, {'created': '2012-02-20 23:00:28.000000000', 'message': 'disk/container_format required on image activate

explicitly set was enforced on the initial image POST, regardless
of whether the image content accompanied that request (either in
as the entity-body, or externally specified via x-image-meta-location).

This turned out to be overly restrictive, as these formats may not
be known to the caller until the image content is supplied via a
subsequent PUT on the new image.

Now we only enforce the strict requirement for these formats to be
non-empty when the image is activated (as opposed to the initial
enqueue).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/62c913c3

Change-Id: I89e068f35fd7da427b547b18cdea4ae84ab3ec87
'}]
commit_message:
disk/container_format required on image activate

Fixes lp 937216

The initial change[1] to require the container and disk formats be
explicitly set was enforced on the initial image POST, regardless
of whether the image content accompanied that request (either in
as the entity-body, or externally specified via x-image-meta-location).

This turned out to be overly restrictive, as these formats may not
be known to the caller until the image content is supplied via a
subsequent PUT on the new image.

Now we only enforce the strict requirement for these formats to be
non-empty when the image is activated (as opposed to the initial
enqueue).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/62c913c3

Change-Id: I89e068f35fd7da427b547b18cdea4ae84ab3ec87

commit_message:
XML de/serialization

Middleware rewrites incoming XML requests as JSON, and passes them on.
Outgoing JSON responses are also rewritten as XML, if the client requests
it.

XML does not entirely match spec (yet!).

Change-Id: I49cbae441f2db7b1dc268df8626e8d81056fdd18

commit_message:
Keystone-related improvements.

  * Repairs updating for users and tenants. Fixes bug 912143.

  * Makes connection caching work for admin keystoneclient calls.
    Adds unit tests for horizon.api.keystone.keystoneclient.
    Fixes bug 933170.

  * In conjunction with this keystoneclient review
    https://review.openstack.org/#change,4133
    it takes care of the following bugs as well:

    Fixes bug 922394. Fixes bug 881606. Fixes bug 918997.

Change-Id: Id72c99772cd214c33fd1aacf357176cf67c6f473
