messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-14 20:41:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hi Eoghan,

Instead of passing the parser to all of the methods in bin/glance, instead could we raise an exception (glance.client.ClientConfigurationError?) from get_client() and trap for that exception in the main loop, thereby having access to the parser variable for doing parser.print_usage() -- which is the only reason that parser is passed to get_client from all the other methods AFAICT?

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-14 21:10:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the feedback, Jay ... yep, good call, that approach would be a lot less invasive. I'll restructure the patch appropriately.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-15 21:47:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-15 22:53:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-16 01:05:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

commit_message:
Require auth URL if keystone strategy is enabled.

Fixes bug 925681

The glance CLI now fails fast if the keystone authentication strategy
is enabled, but the --auth_url option or OS_AUTH_URL environment variable
is not set.

Change-Id: I73bfd4f19a3d882ad53d3d2c914ce11e48ce291d

commit_message:
Fixes bug 885087: /etc/nova/nova.conf

(This commit didn't get backported to redux, so needs to be re-applied now.)

Move Nova config files (nova.conf, api-paste.ini) to /etc/nova
so all binaries can find them, particularly /usr/local/bin/nova-manage.

Change-Id: I002a9ae1c601894c943a49057cdcf0ab9e9d6c61

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-06 06:07:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a thinko: throwing away self.auth_xxxxx

This looks like an obvious buglet. Every other middleware
module sets self.foo=None first, then fills them up from
configuration if present.

With the current code, I always receive code 500 from S3
operations. With the fix I receive 403 (still needs something
else, but this works).

Change-Id: I987521d6147ed5fa21ec4d164211cd56c7c05a6f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a thinko: throwing away self.auth_xxxxx

This looks like an obvious buglet. Every other middleware
module sets self.foo=None first, then fills them up from
configuration if present.

With the current code, I always receive code 500 from S3
operations. With the fix I receive 403 (still needs something
else, but this works).

Change-Id: I987521d6147ed5fa21ec4d164211cd56c7c05a6f

commit_message:
Make lxc a little less racey.

Add error checking for lxc container setup. This will make
LXC container setup a bit more robust. It includes informing
the user is not setup properly and preventing libvirt
from starting when the container is not setup properly.

This fixes bug 849926 and 903927.

Change-Id: I5c1788ef69dd6afb299af4b98a31568966862955
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add SSH Bastion support as alternate cloudpipe.

Updates:
    * moved metadata app to api/metadata/contrib
    * removed project lookup via AuthManager in metadata app
    * pep-8
    * test updates from cloudpipe branch
    * fix test mock in compute test case
    * fix test wsgi app building to not chain through middlewares
    * rebase, change extension namespace, fix tests
    * strip() the keypairs so they json.loads correctly

blueprint ssh-bastion-cloudpipe

Change-Id: I7fa90f3ab9ef742cfdc019d35941562758d397ed

commit_message:
Different exit code in new versions of iscsiadm

Fixes bug #932356
For "iscsiadm: No records found"
if version <= 2.0-871 iscsiadm returns 255
newer versions return 21

Change-Id: Ib4319ed11b20a339b439c70574d0d45acc8814fa

This is a merge commit that will completely replace the contents
of the "master" branch with the contents of the "redux" branch,
which holds the current state and development history of the
project commonly called "keystone light". Run "git review -d
4170" to see what that will look like, and to examine the change
history for keystone light.

When you're ready for this to be merged and become master,
approve the change in the normal way.  We know that this branch
works with the redux branch of devstack, but since we can only
merge one change at a time, this will fail the devstack test.
Once the merge proposals in both projects are approved, we'll
bypass the devstack test and merge them.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-02-15 02:34:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-15 11:51:42.000000000', 'message': 'tests: fix LdapDNS to allow running test_network in isolation

* nova/tests/test_network.py (LdapDNSTestCase): Since the
ldapdns module imports ldap unconditionally, the following
will not run on a system without python-ldap installed
  ./run_tests.sh test_network
Therefore ensure the fake ldap module is used, as is the
case when running the full test suite.

Change-Id: If92c613bf2684c25cdadf2ac7f53f2005979b2b6
'}]
commit_message:
tests: fix LdapDNS to allow running test_network in isolation

* nova/tests/test_network.py (LdapDNSTestCase): Since the
ldapdns module imports ldap unconditionally, the following
will not run on a system without python-ldap installed
  ./run_tests.sh test_network
Therefore ensure the fake ldap module is used, as is the
case when running the full test suite.

Change-Id: If92c613bf2684c25cdadf2ac7f53f2005979b2b6

commit_message:
misc networking fixes

o fixed dns bug where dns was gotten from the wrong subnet
o project_id passed to get_instance_nw_info for when context.project_id
  is null
o removed line breaks around quantum client request to improve
  readability
o project_id passed into vif creation instead of using context
o exception handling around get_attached_ports in quantum connection
o updated object id generation to start with 1 in network_fake
o updated the fake subnets returned in the network_fake
o added proper v6 address generation to network_fake
o improved get_instance_nw_info test
o update api.openstack.compute.test_servers around improved network fake

Change-Id: I74d0a9dbfcbd38e2fbc7d7fefc2587e578980b6e

Allow UUID_CACHE_DIR overriding via env variable.

This is declared as NOVACLIENT_UUID_CACHE_DIR.
Resolves bug 932468 , defaulting to previous behaviour.
Added myself to AUTHORS

commit_message:
Expand Quantum Manager Unit Tests + Associated Fixes

- Add fake quantum client to support more complete testing of Quantum Mgr
- Fix issue related to filters not being appended to Quantum queries
- Expand unit tests to check for # vifs, ports created, nic order.
- Add direct unit tests for quantum_connection class.
- improve error reporting for get_port_by_attachment
- remove invalid comment about not supporting floating IPs
- Remove E-3 hack that only allowed L3 gateway if DHCP was enabled.
Proper way to disable L3 gateway is to use the nova.network.l3.NullL3
driver.
- fix delete_network to properly find UUIDs for project specific networks
- fix issue with 'requested_networks' not working properly for a provider network.
- remove dead chunk of code that is unused because all networks in
quantum currently correspond to an entry in the nova db.
- make sure validate_networks allows both provider + tenant networks.

Update: incorporated feedback from first round of reviews.

Change-Id: Id63d27d457c63efe7ea27a7fbd7470a0a5709125

commit_message:
LOG.exception only works while in an exception handler

It's also unnecessary to set exc_info to sys.exc_info since it does
this for you

Change-Id: Idd8844d18d4945c029f25dd70de7c842bd9a8305

commit_message:
003_add_disk_format.py: Avoid deadlock in upgrade

The connection used to query existing images needs to be closed
earlier to avoid deadlocking later calls thru sqlalchemy.

Fixes bug 932466

Update: Update my email in Authors

Update: Revert Authors email to original, add git commit email
        to .mailamp.

Change-Id: Ic248fdfe3933437928f0b393d8cde993b96bf2cb

subject: New -k/--insecure command line option
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-12 15:03:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

Stuart, I'm so glad we've got someone coding SSL-related stuff that actually understands SSL well (i.e. not me!) :)

Couple teeny style-related nits to address, but overall, great work and great tests.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-12 15:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

One other question: why does this patch add a dependency on the ca-certificates package? Is it just because of the now-default /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt filepath?'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-02-13 13:34:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Jay,

Yes, the ca-certificates was so that the default CA file would be present. Note that in the new patch-set I've made this more distro agnostic."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-02-13 13:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-02-13 13:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-02-13 16:11:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Jay,

Let me know if you think that the setting of the various distro CA files is a bit untidy. It looks like it may be possible to do something along the following lines:

c = OpenSSL.SSL.Context(OpenSSL.SSL.SSLv23_METHOD)
c.set_default_verify_paths()

(This would also require some re-writing of the 'connect' over-ride in HTTPSClientAuthConnection.)"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-14 12:20:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

Thanks Stuart, 

I've added a couple of non-blocking suggestions via in-line comments in patch set 3.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-02-14 14:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

Eoghan, thanks for your review. Return comments.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-14 14:53:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Hi Stuart, agreed on the "insecure" point (see inline response).

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-14 20:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hey Stuart, do we need to add ca-certificates to the pip-requires files because of this?'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2012-02-15 12:48:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Jay, can I double check: pip-requires is just used for the virtual env? Which is just used for unit tests? If so then we don't need to add ca-certificates in there. Where ca-certificates would be recommended would be at the distro level, ie so that for example when you're running the glance client on an Ubuntu machine you have recourse to the default CA file."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-15 13:35:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Yes, Stuart, that is correct... though we sometimes put non-virtualenv-necessary dependencies in pip-requires just to indicate to the user that in a production environment, the package would be useful... In this case, though, I don't think it is a Python package, so it doesn't belong in there anyway ;) Mea culpa!

-jay"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-15 13:44:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/1495/ : SUCCESS

commit_message:
New -k/--insecure command line option

Fix for bug 929591.

Change glance to require server certificate validation
by default when using https. The standard system
CA file will be used if available (and an alternative was not
provided).

The --insecure option can be used by clients to skip server
certificate validation if appropriate.

* This change will impact Nova clients accessing glance over https.
  If the standard CA file is not suitable they will need to provide
  a CA file or else create an 'insecure' glance client.
* Accesses to a https registry server must now perform server
  certificate validation.
* If the package which provides the standard
  system CA file is installed then that file will be used by default.
  It probably makes sense for the glance package to have a
  dependency on whichever package provides the default CA bundle.
  (In Ubuntu this is 'ca-certificates')

Change-Id: I7c83361ba0881559ec77d4baf10dfeb5b8e32185

bug 925348: catch + ignore quantum 404 in get_port_by_attachment

This fixes a race condition where ports fail to be cleaned up when
multiple VMs are deleted simultaneously.

commit_message:
Freeze requirements at sdist time.

If we're in a virtualenv, encode the actual versions of things that we test
against into a standard requirements.txt file which we'll include in the
tarball. Then, use that requirements.txt file in the setup.py, so that a
tarball will install the precise tested versions of things when it is
attempted to be installed.

Change-Id: I59c5da884fbd0795b314a778a26c7936320f55e4

commit_message:
Removes constraints from instance and volume types

 * Gets rid of annoying purge semantics
 * removes unique constraints from the db
 * deletes extra specs when a volume is deleted
 * adds exceptions for when the type already exists
 * fixes bug 854930
 * fixes bug 925823

Change-Id: I4618759e31501b2e85325f4e9b9895f04dc151d0

What's the failure mode without openldap-devel?
I've just did this on RHEL 6.2 without that package, without issue

I guess we'll need to update the dependencies of python-ldap if there is in fact an issue"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-02-13 22:59:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is with venv, without that venv fails to compile the python-ldap python module.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-02-14 23:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

OK cool. So this is just for developers then?
All devs are redirected from this doc to:

So perhaps a RHEL/fedora section is more appropriate there?

commit_message:
Bugfixes for modify project users.

  * Fixes a 500 error when trying to access the modify users view,
    adds a unit test for that. Fixes bug 932270.
  * Fixes a problem in the way BatchAction conjugated action names
    that caused weird behavior. Fixes bug 932288.

Change-Id: Ibf023513f51f3180adf6510833ee760915e7dd91

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-14 10:35:17.000000000', 'message': "Sets default values for month/year at Usage Form in overview page

Fixes bug 931227. The problem is with using 'initial' values for
a bound form. These are mutually exclusive.
Another solution is to use only unbound form,
with setting:
	forms.DateForm(initial={'month':
		self.request.GET.get('month', self.today.month,..)
but in that case all further validations for the form
will be disregarded(although there is no validation atm)

Change-Id: Ie4565b03a1414a0008abfd793d9ec4a181e0aa24
"}]
commit_message:
Sets default values for month/year at Usage Form in overview page

Fixes bug 931227. The problem is with using 'initial' values for
a bound form. These are mutually exclusive.
Another solution is to use only unbound form,
with setting:
	forms.DateForm(initial={'month':
		self.request.GET.get('month', self.today.month,..)
but in that case all further validations for the form
will be disregarded(although there is no validation atm)

Change-Id: Ie4565b03a1414a0008abfd793d9ec4a181e0aa24

messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-26 22:41:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(9 inline comments)

Awesome work Nachi!

Bunch of inline fixes, comments and questions.

The long comment we can address in a later patch.

Can you change the commit message so the blueprint links properly? Something like:

Added resize support for Libvirt/KVM.

Implements blueprint libvirt-resize
This implmenation using scp to copy VM image, so scp command and ssh-pub-key setting is needed."}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2012-01-30 19:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-30 19:17:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks for addressing.'}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2012-01-30 19:20:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-30 19:22:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2012-01-30 19:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Vish 

We fixed all of your point except this one.

File nova/tests/test_virt_drivers.py
Line 467: pass
can we just remove this method?

<--  This method used in child classes, so we can not remove this.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Looks good to me, but see inline.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-02-02 07:33:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Just some high level questions, the code looks good ...

a) I thought I heard someone mention once that they were using a shared filesystem for the instances directory - do we support that? If not, do we have any desire to support using a shared filsystem for this rather than scp?

b) What happens when an admin wants to restart nova-compute after an upgrade? How can she sanely cancel (the long-running scp (or similar tasks) or even just wait for it to finish while blocking new long-running tasks?

c) Why convert from qcow2 to raw? You're losing the compression of sparse disk images when you do that and might be scp-ing gigabytes of zeros to the destination host"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-02 07:49:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Mark: I have an answer for c) if you look at my inline comments in patchset 1. Dealing with a resize on the cow image is a bit more difficult, although I would like to try to address it in a later patch perhaps.

I don't believe a) has been considered. Do you think a flag would cover it? We've been thinking about b) a bit for upgrades, and I think we might have to  use spawn instead of spawn_n and store the greenlets so we can make sure they are done before shutting down. I think this is a more general problem and not specific to this patch though"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-02 11:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Nachi,

Looks like this needs a rebase before it will land:

Auto-merging nova/compute/manager.py
CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in nova/compute/manager.py
Auto-merging nova/tests/test_libvirt.py
CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in nova/tests/test_libvirt.py'}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2012-02-06 18:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2012-02-06 18:38:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Kevin L. Mitchell
< Thanks. I fixed that.

>Mark McLoughlin	
a) I thought I heard someone mention once that they were using a shared filesystem for the instances directory - do we support that? If not, do we have any desire to support using a shared filsystem for this rather than scp?

Your point makes sence.
As Vish said, I wanna support this with another patch.
# Or do you wanna support this in this merge request?

b) What happens when an admin wants to restart nova-compute after an upgrade? How can she sanely cancel (the long-running scp (or similar tasks) or even just wait for it to finish while blocking new long-running tasks?

I'm also think this is general problem. 
Many OpenStack API didn't consider graceful restart or purging from failure.
This should be solved in future release.

c) Why convert from qcow2 to raw? You're losing the compression of sparse disk images when you do that and might be scp-ing gigabytes of zeros to the destination host

Same explanation with Vish.

>Dan Prince	
Thanks for catching this. I rebased changes."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-06 18:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

still lgtm'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-06 18:52:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hmm, I'm getting a traceback when I try to resize an instance. I'll look into it offline and get back to you"}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2012-02-06 19:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

>Brian Waldon	
Thanks for your testing.
Could you share tracebook.
Note SSH certificate setting is needed to use this patch because of using scp.'}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2012-02-06 19:28:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sorry, I'll fix failure of smoke stack."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-06 20:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-13 20:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-13 22:34:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Do not submit

Looks like I need to add a couple things for network.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-02-13 22:35:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I am very hesitant to land this in master (and essex) before repeatable functional testing is set up and before any functional testing has happened. I would prefer we publish it separately (say on github) so that those deployers who are especially interested can have early access. I would be very happy to help with setting up the functional testing for zones/shards and we could keep the published branch up to date as we get the implementation to a working state.

Maybe we should address these concerns in the ongoing FFE discussion around this branch and its dependency."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-13 22:55:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I hear you.  I'm manually functionally testing it right now.  It all works except 2 issues I've seen so far:

1) I have a bug where instance DB entry is somehow not being created immediately at the top level.  The updates from lower level do come back up, though.
2) I'm not pushing up network information, so the cache is empty.  API tries to do rpc calls to network to get info and I had no zones version of that.  I've added it locally and that works now.  I just need to push up the network info now so it doesn't have to query the zone for it."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-14 07:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-14 07:19:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: No score

Basic functionality (build, delete, reboot, rebuild, updating metadata, etc) seems to work with fake virt now.  I suspect most actions will work, since they just get proxied.

Ran into a couple of interesting issues in trunk.  instance['info_cache'] is None initially when instance is created.  This means an immediate get of instance with details (as nova client does as part of 'nova boot') tries to query network API because of how API falls back.

Also: sqlalchemy/api.py update_instance() tries to update metadata if instance['metadata'] is set... but it assumes it is a dictionary... not a list like would have been returned from instance_get().  I've made sure my updates are always a dictionary."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-14 07:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-14 07:49:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

accidentally committed a change to api-paste.ini'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-14 07:54:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Mark: The really pain in the butt thing is going to be the migrations, if I have to wait to merge this. :-/   If there are new migrations, anyone running this will have to deal with manual fiddling with things.  (We need to do something about migrations in general, because it makes it impossible to add-on to nova.)  Factor in the fact that there's issues with the current implementation... I don't know if it's really a bad thing to merge this.  There'll be quite a while to fix issues yet.  But, I'm all for getting help in testing it. ;)"}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-14 15:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (2 inline comments)

Create work, Just a few inline comments.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-14 20:39:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-14 20:40:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Hengqing: Thanks.. I'll look at fixing those up."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-14 21:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-15 00:06:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Do not submit

Going to abandon this.  Split this up to get core changes in for essex.  I'll put up a new branch after the core changes land."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-15 00:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Abandoned

See above.'}]

subject: Merge keystonelight.
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-01-31 18:34:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

what is this?'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-01-31 21:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is a merge commit that will completely replace the contents of the "master" branch with the contents of the "redux" branch, which holds the current state and development history of the project commonly called "keystone light".  Run "git review -d 3572" to see what that will look like, and to examine the change history for keystone light.

I expect that further development will happen on the redux branch as people review it and start testing it.  This merge commit isn't straightforward to generate, so I won't update it again until the redux branch is ready to be merged.  Then, to approve the replacement of keystone with keystone light, the keystone core developers will approve this change.

In the mean time, to work on keystone light, "git checkout redux" to get the branch and "git review redux" to submit changes to it.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-02-14 23:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
_() works best with string literals

Otherwise the tools will miss this string and it won't be
internationalized

Change-Id: I1969e4514adf08f3d67dc9048bf7d44b78700056

subject: Don't query database with an empty list for IN clause
messages:
[{'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-13 21:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-02-13 22:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

why not just do this in the db api?'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-13 22:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-13 22:35:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I looked at doing this in the DB API, but it was a much more invasive change. Specifically because the building of the query is done in exact_filter and there is no way to return that it shouldn't try the query. Using an exception there seemed awkward and made the change much longer.

Also, that isn't the old place where a change is needed.

Maybe a hybrid approach, where the easy places are in the DB layer and the rest are elsewhere?

Although in that case, I'd still probably prefer to do the straightforward and easy fix now, but a better fix encapsulated in the DB layer after Essex is released."}, {'account_id': 693, 'date': '2012-02-14 01:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-14 23:00:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Approved

I'll approve it since it has two +2's"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-14 23:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/1008/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/2768/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-14 23:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Update docs to for current keystone-manage usage

 * Document how to manage users, roles, tenants, services, etc with
   keystoneclient cli
 * keystone-manage only does db_sync right now
 * Fixes bug 931837
 * Add docs for import_legacy and export_legacy_catalog

Change-Id: I7f55fd607363d0cd4f1646564e430dfb5b12855f

commit_message:
Fixes bug 885087: /etc/nova/nova.conf

Move Nova config files (nova.conf, api-paste.ini) to /etc/nova
so all binaries can find them, particularly /usr/local/bin/nova-manage.

Change-Id: I2fb71159c16dffc610dcfda4158593dbd6423c5e

commit_message:
Add token expiration

* Config option token.expiration defines amount of time tokens should be valid
* Fixes bug 928545

Change-Id: I3dff7a1ebf03bb44fc6e5247f976baea0581de08

subject: Add a generic tox build environment.
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-11 16:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

See question inline...'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-02-13 15:29:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

The first thing tox does for me using this branch is run "tox sdist". I think the mistake before was explicitly creating a testenv for sdist as tox will do it anyway.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-02-13 19:55:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There's actually two things (and I'm going to write a wiki page on all of this today)

tox does the sdist and then installs into the venv on everything, as Brian says, which is great.

This change gives us the ability to use tox like the old "with_venv.sh script":

tox -evenv foo

Will run foo in a venv.

(We run sdist inside of a venv in jenkins so that we can collect an exact list of which software versions we tested against)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-14 22:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

thx Monty.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-14 22:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

[{'created': '2012-02-11 07:39:32.000000000', 'message': "Add a generic tox build environment.

Allow for the running of arbitrary commands inside of a venv
so that we don't have to make tox envs for every blessed thing we want to
do.

Change-Id: Ia6f9e3cbeaef27ffe1e60b424c2a2d384e6bad0b
"}]
commit_message:
Add a generic tox build environment.

Allow for the running of arbitrary commands inside of a venv
so that we don't have to make tox envs for every blessed thing we want to
do.

Change-Id: Ia6f9e3cbeaef27ffe1e60b424c2a2d384e6bad0b

commit_message:
Add support for LXC volumes.

This introduces volume support for LXC containers in Nova.
The way that this works is that when a device is attached to an
LXC container is that, the xml is parsed to find out which device to
connect to the LXC container, binds the device to the LXC container,
and allow the device through cgroups.

This bug fixes LP: #924601.

Change-Id: I00b41426ae8354b3cd4212655ecb48319a63aa9b
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix for User update form in syspanel

Fixes bug 912143

Patch contains:
1. Fix for update_email method, which is now
required in Keystone API
2. Showing user.name in the User update for,
so it is accessible later in Page postback

NOTE: requires a patch in python-keystone client
for the changes to take effect.

Change-Id: I76bb789e164163b6f625e1784b08f233ded11f7b

commit_message:
Add s3_token.

Add s3_token middleware originally written by Akira YOSHIYAMA.
Make it works with new swift_auth.
Make not necessary modification to swift3 middleware.
Handle errors when connecting to keystone.
Address termie's comment in reviews.

Change-Id: Icb2ae3fe79296ee6415dd55d146339ab72dd1d46

available.

Change-Id: Ic26e4d701ad22a21f06d7142f6ce91583acb5816
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure sane chunk size when pysendfile unavailable.

Fixes lp 932183

Previously, small and erratically-sized HTTP chunks were sent
when pysendfile was unsupported on a particulat platform.

Now, non-terminal chunks will be of size 64k as long data is
available.

Change-Id: Ic26e4d701ad22a21f06d7142f6ce91583acb5816

dude, you've gotta go read some other code or docs on how to indent python, i'm just going to mark all the lines that are being done in something other than the normal way"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-09 23:19:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(8 inline comments)

when escaping a newline (which, honestly, should very rarely be done, so it is a little awkward that it is happening so much), one double-indents so that in reading the code it does not look like a control structure. It is almost always preferably to split lines inside parens rather than escaping newlines.

when continuing lines inside of parens, one usually indents the newline to match the stuff inside the parens.

it seems like pep8 should have caught the two many spaces on 138, are you running the tests?"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-10 18:38:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, I removed all the newlines and made them as temporary variable and now pep8 didn't notify any errors on those spaces and (and I did read pep8 document for coding style)."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-10 18:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2012-02-10 22:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Update swift token middleware.

- Update swift middleware which add features:
    - Leaves authententication to token-auth.
    - ACL.
    - Container-Sync
    - Referer.
    - S3.
- address termie comments on reviews.

Change-Id: Iefaa228015d6286e4fb05be2cc24aec01589ef58

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-13 23:30:15.000000000', 'message': "Refactored test suite.

  * Moves all tests to use a single set of central test data and
    Adds a nifty manager for it.
    Implements blueprint unified-test-data.

  * Cleans up API code and API tests so that we're not testing
    code that has no custom logic, or wrapping objects unnecessarily.
    Implements blueprint api-simplification.

  * Adds lots of docs on testing. It's a good step towards
    blueprint improve-dev-documentation.

  * Improves API exception handling for duplicate objects and containers.
    Fixes bug 930816.

Change-Id: I5526ccf5b38708885ea2d1f06b0d3483c58c4dad
"}]
commit_message:
Refactored test suite.

  * Moves all tests to use a single set of central test data and
    Adds a nifty manager for it.
    Implements blueprint unified-test-data.

  * Cleans up API code and API tests so that we're not testing
    code that has no custom logic, or wrapping objects unnecessarily.
    Implements blueprint api-simplification.

  * Adds lots of docs on testing. It's a good step towards
    blueprint improve-dev-documentation.

  * Improves API exception handling for duplicate objects and containers.
    Fixes bug 930816.

Change-Id: I5526ccf5b38708885ea2d1f06b0d3483c58c4dad

Handle unicode keys in memcache token backend

* Cast keys to str in memcache backend
* Emulate encoding error in fake memcache client
* Fixes bug 931746

Change-Id: I13bc573d4aca6849b1b8128ab55823545d5a3a11

commit_message:
Fix WADL/PDF docs referenced in describedby links

These compute API links were broken, previously referring to
Rackspace URLs with s/v1.0/v1.1/

The links now correctly reference long-lived locations on
docs.openstack.org.

Change-Id: I10efca2868a05982a1783688e374060acf1d0a69

commit_message:
077_convert_to_utf8: Migrate all FK tables early

The original migration only takes care of migrating the instances
table before all others.  It turns out, when using MySQL with InnoDB
by default, there are many other tables with FKs that need to converted
early on as well (see bug description for schema diagram).

Fixes bug 931602.

Update: pep8 cleanup

Change-Id: I5a2f182fd000949c98079cc2896a50bff9df2dae

commit_message:
Make floating ip test work. Fixes bug 929765.

The problems were:
1. FloatingIP client does not use json/headers for POST
2. The API data for associate/disassociate floating ip were wrong
3. The negative cases were too specific about what exception would be thrown

Also made test_server_metadata work.

Change-Id: I5bea4e03203391042589ba264d9eaed3ef1199b3

Make test_flavors.py pass.

There were some "expect failures" for bugs that have been fixed in Essex.
Added release_name, defaulting to essex, to allow skipping of tests of things
that are broken in diablo but fixed in essex.

Change-Id: I38ada5ee200104efe112a3bcd12b902c63e4b9ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-06 06:25:44.000000000', 'message': "Handle refactoring of libvirt image caching.

This patch handles the refactored image caching for libvirt. The
new scheme keeps multiple copies of an image:

  <fingerprint>:        the image from glance
  <fingerprint>_<size>: the resized image

The resized image is then copied or CoW'd across to the instance
disk. We also want to keep original images from glance longer than
we keep the resized images, as they're smaller and this reduces the
load on glance. Therefore a new flag to handle the differing rules
has been added.

Change-Id: If6d9471b3d67cb8fac3f168b1b4a3cd57b9cc9a7
"}, {'created': '2012-02-06 08:56:08.000000000', 'message': "Handle refactoring of libvirt image caching.

commit_message:
Handle refactoring of libvirt image caching.

This patch handles the refactored image caching for libvirt. The
new scheme keeps multiple copies of an image:

  <fingerprint>:        the image from glance
  <fingerprint>_<size>: the resized image

The resized image is then copied or CoW'd across to the instance
disk. We also want to keep original images from glance longer than
we keep the resized images, as they're smaller and this reduces the
load on glance. Therefore a new flag to handle the differing rules
has been added.

Change-Id: If6d9471b3d67cb8fac3f168b1b4a3cd57b9cc9a7

subject: Allow to force using RACKSPACE_SERVICENET by env.
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-01-30 14:32:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Chmouel!

See https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg07109.html for a discussion of why it might be nice to eventually generalize this setting in Swift to remove (rename?) the Rackspace-specific ServiceNET terminology in favour of a private vs. public network semantics...

Not necessarily for this particular patch, but food for thought.

Cheers!

-jay'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-01-30 15:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello Jay,

Well this is actually this discussion that prompt me this patch. I think that feature is very Rackspace specific, the idea would be you could remove that part of code in glance and the library would switch to SERVICENET if someone define this environement variable.

As far goes to remove totally this feature from swift as well I am not networking expert but I doubt a lot of people would want to implement like the way Rackspace implemented it. Ultimately this kind of thing should be transparent to the end-user without having to do a dns hack

Chmouel.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2012-01-30 16:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IMHO I think alot of providers might want or have a concept of Public vs Private Network.  I think the term "ServiceNet" is just too Rackspace specific, and should probably be more generic (PrivateNet ?).'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-01-30 18:07:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ah, sorry, Chmouel, I didn't realize that's what you were attempting to do. For the record, I wasn't advocating removal of this functionality from Swift, just making it more generic *if possible*. Sounds like that *may* not be possible?"}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2012-01-30 19:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why using an environment variable here and not a parameter for the CLI? It sounds like we'll have two ways for configuration the CLI later: environment variables and parameters for the CLI. I don't see the benefit of an environment variable compared to a parameter for the CLI.

In the bugreport: "so make it easy for people to deploy under RAX DC or not without modifying code". I think if the need for an environment variable is only because of the used base it should not be introduced, because it's very specific.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-01-31 14:18:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I agree with Florian. We should try to move away from Rackspace-specific semantics. I think a public vs private network will be common with openstack deployments. Choosing between them should not be done with a "RACKSPACE_SERVICENET" variable.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2012-01-31 14:27:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Forgot to set -1 :( As commented before I see it like Florian, too."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-01 09:45:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Fair enough I totally understand not having RAX specific feature in swift, but this may a bit tricky to address. 

different options I can see to solve this with my comments underneath it. FWIW my preference would go for (4). 

1) Remove totally the support of snet in swift client.
=> This will break code using swift.client for accessing RAX cloud and would make people use the 'slow' python-cloudfiles library.

2) Rename snet variable to privatenet and allow redefinition of the DNS suffix to make it a more generic feature.
=> That still will break code but at least that will make more of a generic feature for everyone to use.

3) Leave it like that but not adding env support
=> the env support only make it easier for deployment team who needs that feature it does not add or remove the snet feature from swift.client.

4) Add env support but only change the variable RACKSPACE_SERVER to something like PRIVATENET_FEATURE (or whatever we choose), not change the snet variable in the code but allow to override the prefix.
=> Would be a bit more generic and will not need a client change."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-02-01 15:42:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I like Chmouel's #4 with the long-term goal of adding #2. Keep a generic env variable now, and eventually move to a generic "snet" config setting.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-06 15:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Okay thanks for the feedback John, will implement #4.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-02-14 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-02-14 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-14 11:48:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is still on my TODO list, let's try to reopen it."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-01-30 03:35:56.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to force using RACKSPACE_SERVICENET by env.

If you specify a defined RACKSPACE_SERVICENET it will force it to use
the rackspace specific feature servicenet.

Fixes bug 923581.

Change-Id: I5506724ad73bcc0182b2449cfb112f9c5ce0e3d0
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to force using RACKSPACE_SERVICENET by env.

If you specify a defined RACKSPACE_SERVICENET it will force it to use
the rackspace specific feature servicenet.

Fixes bug 923581.

Change-Id: I5506724ad73bcc0182b2449cfb112f9c5ce0e3d0

subject: Ubuntu Lucid Support for devstack
messages:
[{'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-02-06 21:17:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

IMHO: This is a fairly big change to support the lucid distribution. 

This is nice to have another distro supported but I would say that devstack is mostly designed for bleeding edge distributions and should be targeted for the only latest.

Another argument would be that if we add LTS support this could maybe encourage people to run on production which defeat the point of devstack.

Adding this patch as well would add more complexities to the script which by design I would say the script should be keep as lean and readable as possible."}, {'account_id': 2515, 'date': '2012-02-06 21:37:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The patch is for developers who want to run openstack on the same distribution that is in production. (Typically production systems run LTS)

Granted this patch will be useless in 2 months (New LTS out in april). devstack compatibility for the current LTS could be useful to many developers.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-02-06 22:36:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I like the change to get_packages, that addresses some other things we've thought about too.

We have putting thought recently into support for other distros, where distro = {ubuntu,fedora,debian,centos,etc}, not just releases within a distro  The hard part turns out to be managing the combinations of packages required.  I am currently of the mind that we will provide the base package lists for  current distro releases plus the mechanism to handle exceptions.

The problem with adding lucid, or CentOS 5 or whatever is that we (devstack developers) don't use them so it is likely the package lists will rot over time.  See the Hyper-V discussion last week on the ML.

One more thought.  Those who are likely to be running an aging LTS Ubuntu release are also likely to be running non-cutting-edge OpenStack releases.  Today this combo might be diablo or cactus on lucid.  We have a stable/diablo devstack branch and will continue to have branches that match up to OpenStack releases.  The expectation might be that trunk devstack is less likely to work on anything older than current-1."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-02-14 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-02-14 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-03 21:14:43.000000000', 'message': 'Ubuntu Lucid Support for devstack

* Modified get_packages so it could be used to specify which pip packages should be installed on a per distribution basis.
* Added files/dist/lucid to keep distro specific changes separate
* Modified what packages could be installed for lucid

Change-Id: I40d42917a940a616191fa72e221970227283503d
'}]
commit_message:
Ubuntu Lucid Support for devstack

* Modified get_packages so it could be used to specify which pip packages should be installed on a per distribution basis.
* Added files/dist/lucid to keep distro specific changes separate
* Modified what packages could be installed for lucid

Change-Id: I40d42917a940a616191fa72e221970227283503d

[{'created': '2012-01-23 17:01:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix inconsistencies in swift-init reload and restart

Addresses bug 920520.

Change to swift-init restart so services are stop/started consecutively rather than all stopped first then all started. The service stop function now checks to see if a service is running before stopping it to avoid returning error on unconfigured services.
Some of the exit codes still don't seem right - but they are consistent across similar commands.

Change-Id: I9a173bb5dd690331c41c67c04f7250010cb07ed8
"}]
commit_message:
Fix inconsistencies in swift-init reload and restart

Addresses bug 920520.

Change to swift-init restart so services are stop/started consecutively rather than all stopped first then all started. The service stop function now checks to see if a service is running before stopping it to avoid returning error on unconfigured services.
Some of the exit codes still don't seem right - but they are consistent across similar commands.

Change-Id: I9a173bb5dd690331c41c67c04f7250010cb07ed8

commit_message:
Blueprint cli-auth

* Add proper test for swift in client-env.sh
* Remove all VERIFY variables; nothing beyond the 4 OS_ vars is set now
* Update exercises for Keystone 2.0 auth
* swift understands Keystone 2.0 auth now, don't download custom binary
* cleanup uploaded bundle in bundle.sh

Change-Id: I99c818d81534bbf93c0e142513acb80e5fe613ea

Adds api site including WADLs for Compute, Identity, and Image APIs

Change-Id: Id0dae44d9dca3005f3c77aa8f0575ca411f9c225

subject: Changes for supporting fast cloning on Xenserver. Implements blueprint fast-cloning-for-xenserver 	1. use_cow_images flag is reused for xenserver to check if copy on write images should be used. 	2. image-id is used to tag an image which has already been streamed from glance. 	3. If cow is true, when an instance of an image is created for the first time on a given xenserver, the image is streamed from glance and copy on write disk is created for the instance. 	4. For subsequent instance creation requests (of the same image), a copy on write disk is created from the base image that is already present on the host. 	5. If cow is false, when an instance of an image is created for the first time on a host, the image is streamed from glance and its copy is made to create a virtual disk for the instance. 	6. For subsequent instance creation requests, a copy of disk is made for creating the disk for the instance. 	7. Snapshot creation code was updated to handle cow=true. Now there can be upto 3 disks in the chain. The base disk needs to be uploaded too. 	8. Also added a cache_images flag. Depending on whether the flag is turned on on not, images will be cached on the host.

[{'account_id': 706, 'date': '2012-01-25 05:17:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

It's late here, but I did notice 1 quick fix. I like the possibilities here, so I'll be back to do a more thorough review."}, {'account_id': 2093, 'date': '2012-01-25 08:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-01-25 09:13:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It's extremely late where I am so I'd appreciate the opportunity to review this tomorrow when I'm more coherent before someone approves."}, {'account_id': 2093, 'date': '2012-01-27 08:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Chris, Brian, Rick; did you get a change to look at the updated changes. Do let me know if you have any comments.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-01-30 02:39:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not submit

(4 inline comments)

So, this is awesome.  I have some comments inline.  Besides those, I really think there should be a flag to turn the caching on and off with a default of 'off'.  I think the default could then be reviewed at a major release point.  One might not expect a behavior change like this when doing an upgrade and in case it is broken in some way, it'd be nice to turn it off.

Other comment:  I'm not sure if this can go into Essex, because I think it is a 'new feature' and we're in feature freeze.  But if this gets an exception and my issues are addressed, I'd be happy to approve it."}, {'account_id': 2093, 'date': '2012-01-30 12:42:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

Regarding turning caching off by default; here we are using the 'use_cow_images' flag. The same flag is used in libvirt too where it defaults to 'true' right now. If we turn it off here, the default behavior for libvirt will change.
Should we have a separate flag for xenapi? To me, it didn't look right having two separate flags for xenapi and libvirt."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-01-30 12:49:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

From what I could tell, the cow flag would turn off cloning, however you'd still cache the image and do a copy (instead of cloning) of it for subsequent builds.  Did I read it wrong?  I was proposing a flag for the caching."}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2012-01-30 12:54:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I agree with Devdeep that this should be controlled by the same flag as in libvirt. We need less divergence between libvirt and XenServer.

However, I agree with Chris that this is a new feature and is inappropriate for Essex. You can request a feature freeze exception, though. More details here:

   https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg06962.html"}, {'account_id': 2093, 'date': '2012-01-31 06:39:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Chris, you read it correct. My understanding of what you were suggesting was wrong. If I go ahead and add a new flag for caching in xenapi, then the behavior between libvirt and xenapi will again differ. Libvirt doesn't use any such flag for caching. Will it be fine?

Soren, thanks for the pointer to the feature freeze exception link."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-31 16:48:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

we can key the libvirt caching off of a flag pretty easily. We just could just do a mv from _base into the dir instead of a cp.  That said, I'm not sure what to do about the default.  We default cow and cache to on."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-01-31 19:08:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Soren, yeah, I wasn't proposing a new flag for cow behavior.  I was proposing a new flag for caching behavior.  Those are 2 separate things in my mind.  And I admit to not knowing that libvirt did caching by default.  I agree that Xen therefore needs to do caching by default.  That means that XenServer is now going to start doing fast cloning and caching out of the box, which is a behavior difference.  There's a flag for 'cow' so that Xen folks can revert to the old behavior.  However, there's no flag for 'caching' to revert to the old behavior.  I'd like to have the ability to turn 'caching' off so Xen folks can preserve their current behavior if they need it."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-01-31 21:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2093, 'date': '2012-02-01 14:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2093, 'date': '2012-02-01 14:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

As per the discussion, I have added a new flag for caching images for xenapi. I have also addressed the review comments that were given earlier.'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2012-02-01 17:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Devdeep, could you update the commit message to reflect the latest changes? 
Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-01 17:17:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think chris said that he is ok with cache_images defaulting to true since kvm already does it, with the ability to turn it off.  Once this lands, I'm happy to do a fix to support the flag in libvirt.

Also can you change the first line of your commit message to:
Changes for supporting fast cloning on Xenserver.
And put the following on a later line?
Implements blueprint fast-cloning-for-xenserver"}, {'account_id': 2093, 'date': '2012-02-01 19:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2093, 'date': '2012-02-03 06:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Changes for supporting fast cloning on Xenserver.
Implements blueprint fast-cloning-for-xenserver
	1. use_cow_images flag is reused for xenserver to check if copy on write images should be used.
	2. image-id is used to tag an image which has already been streamed from glance.
	3. If cow is true, when an instance of an image is created for the first time on a given xenserver, the image is streamed from glance and copy on write disk is created for the instance.
	4. For subsequent instance creation requests (of the same image), a copy on write disk is created from the base image that is already present on the host.
	5. If cow is false, when an instance of an image is created for the first time on a host, the image is streamed from glance and its copy is made to create a virtual disk for the instance.
	6. For subsequent instance creation requests, a copy of disk is made for creating the disk for the instance.
	7. Snapshot creation code was updated to handle cow=true. Now there can be upto 3 disks in the chain. The base disk needs to be uploaded too.
	8. Also added a cache_images flag. Depending on whether the flag is turned on on not, images will be cached on the host.

Change-Id: I54838a24b061c134877f3479c925c6ee78da14bc

[{'created': '2012-02-03 05:33:20.000000000', 'message': 'get_user behavior in ldapdriver

* Addresses bug 744462

Rather than ldapdriver.ge_user() returning None for non-existent
user, this change implements exception.LDAPUserNotFound to more
closely match the behavior of other drivers (db).

Change was made in public method only, and _check_user_exists()
which uses get_user() now catches and returns None if applicable.
Unit tests all run succesfully again, and test of implemented exception
has been added.

commit_message:
get_user behavior in ldapdriver

* Addresses bug 744462

Rather than ldapdriver.get_user() returning None for non-existent
user, this change implements exception.LDAPUserNotFound to more
closely match the behavior of other drivers (db).

Change was made in public method only, and _check_user_exists()
which uses get_user() now catches and returns None if applicable.
Implemented test of NotFound exception in base auth test class.

Change-Id: Ia13af759931ca0c7327d54184730537bafbe52ae

commit_message:
shell: Hook --debug up to more stuff

Particularly to pythons logging infrastructure, and to always print
a backtrace if the CLI throws an exception. Show --debug in the
help output since end users may certainly have legitimate reasons for
wanting debug output.

Change-Id: Icfdaaf5511db8eecbf650e7ef4437b342b560141

subject: Fsck disk before removing journal
messages:
[{'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-13 22:38:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm a little uncomfortable with forcing repairs to the filesystem in addition to replaying the journal.

Why not try to use e2fsck to replay the journal only since that is the most likely failure and is probably the safest thing to do."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-13 23:04:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-13 23:06:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

After discussing w/ Johannes in #ozone, we decided that auto repairing the FS may be a little too risky at the moment. Instead we'll take the cautious approach of do nothing, and if we detect failures, we'll have to investigate this further."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-13 23:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Pass instance to log messages.

This patch converts more log messages to passing their instance.
Having the instance in a consistant format in the logs makes it
easier for operations staff to debug instance problems.

Change-Id: I842f26309e17c0923e71fbfb00bdcdb033f92297

commit_message:
remove a private duplicate function

* nova/network/ldapdns.py (utf-8): This function is already
available in nova.utils.  Note this duplicate was catching
impossible to trigger exceptions, and was referencing an
undefined variable 'val'

Change-Id: I0e47f8b976a3326c99927990f91be473c0a85f78

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-13 21:09:22.000000000', 'message': 'Use stubs in libvirt/utils get_fs_info test

This test frequently breaks for me because of a race condition where
some small change will happen to the file system between when df is
called and when os.statvfs is called. By refactoring the test to stubs,
we can eliminate the race condition. Note that I do not modify the code
under test at all in this change, so the risk of introducing a defect is
zero.

Change-Id: I83e4b38b25fef7e5e27fcf81b5e5a566406b05dd
'}]
commit_message:
Use stubs in libvirt/utils get_fs_info test

This test frequently breaks for me because of a race condition where
some small change will happen to the file system between when df is
called and when os.statvfs is called. By refactoring the test to stubs,
we can eliminate the race condition. Note that I do not modify the code
under test at all in this change, so the risk of introducing a defect is
zero.

Change-Id: I83e4b38b25fef7e5e27fcf81b5e5a566406b05dd

commit_message:
Fixes logic for toggle Pause/Suspend actions
Fixes bug 925395. Added functionality in BatchAction to support
multiple actions. The verbose_names are accordingly changed
in update method. It is only required that the current
action index is set in the control.

Patch 2: Applied code changes to newly added classes

Patch 3: Refactored logic, added unit tests for batch actions and for verbose_names on all actions

Patch 4: Resolved conflicts with newly added code in horizon/horizon/tests/table_tests.py

Change-Id: I7cbdce25b8ae027ff1a153b3379add1b66b8aa76

Improved AJAX polling.

Fixes several bugs:
-removes an uncaught exception
-non-ASCII statuses are now valid
-query strings no longer grow forever during polling

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-03 21:25:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix bug 904364: Consistiently handle trailing '/' on URLs

novaclient used to require a trailing '/' on --auth-url and would
mysteriously break if it was not present.  This is mostly due to
urlparse.urljoin()'s behaviour; it was only used here for concatenation
so it was eliminated and trailing '/' chars consistiently stripped.
All url concatenation now requires the second element to begin
with '/'.

Change-Id: I99e95ea92682d917348201bc3190a1e77bbcbff0
"}, {'created': '2012-02-03 22:13:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix bug 904364: Consistiently handle trailing '/' on URLs

commit_message:
Fix bug 904364: Consistiently handle trailing '/' on URLs

novaclient used to require a trailing '/' on --auth-url and would
mysteriously break if it was not present.  This is mostly due to
urlparse.urljoin()'s behaviour; it was only used here for concatenation
so it was eliminated and trailing '/' chars consistiently stripped.
All url concatenation now requires the second element to begin
with '/'.

Change-Id: I99e95ea92682d917348201bc3190a1e77bbcbff0

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-13 14:42:06.000000000', 'message': 'Make floating ip test work. Fixes bug 929765.

The problems were:
1. FloatingIP client does not use json/headers for POST
2. The API data for associate/disassociate floating ip were wrong
3. The negative cases were too specific about what exception would be thrown

Also made test_server_metadata work.

Change-Id: I5bea4e03203391042589ba264d9eaed3ef1199b3
'}]
commit_message:
Make floating ip test work. Fixes bug 929765.

The problems were:
1. FloatingIP client does not use json/headers for POST
2. The API data for associate/disassociate floating ip were wrong
3. The negative cases were too specific about what exception would be thrown

Also made test_server_metadata work.

Change-Id: I5bea4e03203391042589ba264d9eaed3ef1199b3

commit_message:
Don't log sensitive data in compute log file.

Sanitize run_instance's admin_password argument from
nova.rpc 'received' debug logging. Fixes bug 915025.

Sanitize new_pass from set_admin_password.  Fixes bug 920687.

Manually merged from:
  ccbc940211c348940ca9766ef60328302a080f9a
  fa10e7ad5b3f6ab5de5b7b187da7a8bf05a263d5

Change-Id: I3af8263f88ef2e68d5d7f6d8c4824737fffcf461

commit_message:
Fixing a unicode related metadata bug.

When a server had metadata with unicode characters in the values, doing a GET
on servers details would return a 500 error. This fixes that bug.

bug: 929281
Change-Id: I6162532c9a5a615802eb23e7bf9a80d3faf6e7a0

commit_message:
Make melange_port an integer

It's nonsensical as anything but an integer and it makes it clearer what
type it should be.

Change-Id: Icd62023b1835d33fb977302208744657e4557d2a

commit_message:
Full support for dashboard and panel configuration via service catalog.

There are no longer any dependencies on settings for whether or not
particular components are made available in the site.

Implements blueprint toggle-features.

Also fixes bug 929983, making the Horizon object a proper
singleton and ensuring test isolation for the base horizon tests.

Fixes a case where a missing service catalog would cause
a 500 error. Fixes bug 930833,

Change-Id: If19762afe75859e63aa7bd5128a6795655df2c90

commit_message:
Cleanup on syspanel.images code, and unuset template removal.

A lot of templates got left behind after the datatables refactor which
are no longer used or necessary.

There was also some strange behavior in the syspanel images table
where outdated javascript would try to hide other rows in the table
causing bad behavior.

Change-Id: If7aa226336f0814782522b20c76eadc39613c372

commit_message:
cfg: unneeded multiple inheritance

Fixed bug #927650

In python=<2.6, collections.Mapping inherits from
collections.Sized, collections.Iterable, and collections.Container
which are also subclasses of object.

Change-Id: I6238c683324127abd9fb637748a10b6bdb2961e0

subject: Making sure to check the instance is valid before allocating ips.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1175, 'name': 'Craig Vyvial'}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1175, 'date': '2012-02-02 21:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-02 22:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1175, 'date': '2012-02-03 03:44:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-03 07:59:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

Please remove the unnecessary decorator and resubmit."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-03 08:08:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not submit

I'm a bit concerned about a few things here:

a) the performance hit

b) the coupling of network and compute.

The Network Manager should not be loading compute objects to see if they exist. If any api calls should be done it should be done at the api layer before a remote call to the manager is made. Moreover I actually think that this is verification that we do not need to be doing. Network doesn't care if the instance exists, it cares whether any of its records  have instance_id set.  I think we should rethink this bug"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-03 08:10:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The code, by the way, is great. I just disagree with the original bug report.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-02-11 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-02-11 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review'}]

commit_message:
remove all instance_type db lookups from network

increases efficiency without requiring extra parameters

Change-Id: I858067afb94007c8e71748373873f7cc8bd54662

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-08 20:52:33.000000000', 'message': 'Remedies LP Bug #928910 - Use libvirt lookupByName() to check existence

Make determining if an instance exists on a host
more efficient by adding an instance_exists() method to the
base virt driver that may be overridden by drivers that
have a more efficient mechanism of looking up an instance
by its ID / name. Modifies the _check_instance_already_created
method of the compute manager to use this new more-efficient
mechanism.

Change-Id: Ibf219788f9c104698057367da89300a060945778
'}, {'created': '2012-02-08 22:36:38.000000000', 'message': 'Remedies LP Bug #928910 - Use libvirt lookupByName() to check existence

Make determining if an instance exists on a host
more efficient by adding an instance_exists() method to the
base virt driver must be overridden by drivers that
have a more efficient mechanism of looking up an instance
by its ID / name. Modifies the _check_instance_already_created
method of the compute manager to use this new more-efficient
mechanism.

Note that I totally left an inefficient implementation in the Xen
virt driver because I got frustrated trying to answer a seemingly
simple question about XenAPI lookupByName comparable API call. If
there is a Citrix person that knows the answer, feel free to re-implement
the instance_exists() method in /nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: Ibf219788f9c104698057367da89300a060945778
'}, {'created': '2012-02-10 22:11:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remedies LP Bug #928910 - Use libvirt lookupByName() to check existence

Make determining if an instance exists on a host
more efficient by adding an instance_exists() method to the
base virt driver that can be overridden by drivers that
have a more efficient mechanism of looking up an instance
by its ID / name. Modifies the _check_instance_already_created
method of the compute manager to use this new instance_exists() method.

Someone from Citrix should look into how to make the instance_exists()
method in the Xen and VMWare virt drivers more efficient than the
base "loop over all domains and see if the instance ID exists" method
now in the base driver class.

Change-Id: Ibf219788f9c104698057367da89300a060945778
'}]
commit_message:
Remedies LP Bug #928910 - Use libvirt lookupByName() to check existence

Make determining if an instance exists on a host
more efficient by adding an instance_exists() method to the
base virt driver that can be overridden by drivers that
have a more efficient mechanism of looking up an instance
by its ID / name. Modifies the _check_instance_already_created
method of the compute manager to use this new instance_exists() method.

Someone from Citrix should look into how to make the instance_exists()
method in the Xen and VMWare virt drivers more efficient than the
base "loop over all domains and see if the instance ID exists" method
now in the base driver class.

Change-Id: Ibf219788f9c104698057367da89300a060945778

remove unused and buggy function from baremetal proxy

reference 'images' which is undefined.  So just remove it
as it's unused.

commit_message:
Retry on network failure for melange GET requests

Fixes bug 929041

The melange service may need to periodically be restarted for various
operations reasons, so retry GET requests if we receive a socket error.

Change-Id: I010650dac7793d0041d41be067eb4b32e2171c8a

commit_message:
linux_net: Also ignore shell error 2 from ip addr

Ignores error code 2 from 'ip addr {add, del}' which, in recent
versions of iproute2, means the address has already been removed
or added.

Fixes bug 929127

Change-Id: I09274454847ff834ac3da0e38022b30a7a7f1676

Fix exception by passing timeout as None

The call method takes a new timeout argument, but not all uses of it
were updated to pass the new argument.

notifications to a message queue via Qpid.

[{'created': '2012-02-10 22:03:32.000000000', 'message': 'Re-adds ssl to kombu configuration and adds flags that are needed to pass through to kombu.

Implements part of blueprint ssl-endpoints

Adds in configuration options:

kombu_ssl_version (ssl version)
kombu_ssl_keyfile (ssl keyfile)
kombu_ssl_certfile (ssl certfile)
kombu_ssl_ca_certs (ssl ca certfile)

This adds onto rabbit_use_ssl (which must be True for the above to have any effect) and allows
users to specify in greater detail (more than just True/False) how SSL is going to be configured.

Change-Id: Ibeb365eaa5edfad3eb07f5ab35faebbbdd9b3ce0
'}]
commit_message:
Re-adds ssl to kombu configuration and adds flags that are needed to pass through to kombu.

Implements part of blueprint ssl-endpoints

Adds in configuration options:

kombu_ssl_version (ssl version)
kombu_ssl_keyfile (ssl keyfile)
kombu_ssl_certfile (ssl certfile)
kombu_ssl_ca_certs (ssl ca certfile)

This adds onto rabbit_use_ssl (which must be True for the above to have any effect) and allows
users to specify in greater detail (more than just True/False) how SSL is going to be configured.

Change-Id: Ibeb365eaa5edfad3eb07f5ab35faebbbdd9b3ce0

commit_message:
Optimizes ec2 keystone usage and handles errors

 * breaks out gen_request_id so we can return it in error msg
 * breaks out ec2_error so we can use it in multiple middlewares
 * adds new middleware (remove old after devstack change)
 * skips extra call to keystone for second authentication
 * fixes bug 922373

Change-Id: If765d149289255b0bf0e0c1b647ebb547ce5759b

Remove the last of the gflags shim layer

Make FLAGS a ConfigOpts instance and fix up all the places where we
expected FlagValues behaviour.

[{'created': '2012-02-10 17:42:15.000000000', 'message': "Extend glance retries to show() as well

Fixes bug 930245

nova/image/glance.py would already retry get() requests if there was a
connection error, but didn't do so for show() requests.

Change-Id: Ifb1a17da18b7e10ddaaec46e124efcc963681c80
"}]
commit_message:
Extend glance retries to show() as well

Fixes bug 930245

nova/image/glance.py would already retry get() requests if there was a
connection error, but didn't do so for show() requests.

Change-Id: Ifb1a17da18b7e10ddaaec46e124efcc963681c80

commit_message:
Fix status transition when reverting resize

Present the instance being reverted with a 'REVERT_RESIZE' status instead
of 'ACTIVE' after a revertResize action is triggered. Fixes bug 924371

Change-Id: I12e98733fd00c0794fb9a4acb0cc6752ca02e855

commit_message:
Allows pluggable algorithms for address generation.

Addresses blueprint scalability by extracting out ip/mac addresss generation
into separate pluggable components. Allows the address generator plugins to
create their own models and database tables.

Change-Id: If85b6c73d1e30c92f0e2ea80fea028813d612cb8

subject: Pass in project_id in ext. authorizer
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-07 00:06:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'm okay with this, but I do want to point out that this will be providing the exact same dict of credentials that we are matching against in the policy checks."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-07 23:45:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

bcwaldon: Can you provide more detail on that caveat, I'm not exact sure what you mean here.

Is there a more concise or general way of handling this?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-09 19:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So the dict you pass in should be an object that you want to check ownership of. It is going to use the context object to pull off user/tenant. If you pass in user and tenant from the context, the checks will always pass.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-02-09 21:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

bcwaldon: Gotcha, so, not really an a problem, just a quirk of the implementation it sounds like.

FYI, I basically copied that code from something you wrote (or at least git-blame reports you wrote), in nova/compute/api.py:create.'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-02-10 19:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved
